111001.name: ColecoVision Controller
111001.description:
The design of the controllers is similar to that of Mattel's Intellivision the controller is rectangular and consists of a numeric keypad and a set of side buttons. In place of the circular control disc below the keypad, the Coleco controller has a short, 1.5-inch joystick. The keypad is designed to accept a thin plastic overlay that maps the keys for a particular game. Each original ColecoVision console shipped with two controllers.

Source: Wikipedia, "Coleco Vision", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

111002.name: ColecoVision Expansion Module #1
111002.description:
From its introduction, Coleco had touted a hardware add-on called the Expansion Module #1 which made the ColecoVision compatible with the industry-leading Atari 2600. Functionally, this gave the ColecoVision the largest software library of any console of its day. The expansion module prompted legal action from Atari, but Atari was unable to stop sales of the module because the 2600 could be reproduced with standard parts. Coleco was also able to design and market the Gemini game system which was an exact clone of the 2600, but with combined joystick/paddle controllers.

Source: Wikipedia, "Coleco Vision", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

111003.name: ColecoVision Expansion Module #2
111003.description:
Expansion Module #2 is a driving controller expansion that consists of a steering wheel, gas pedal and the pack-in game Turbo. The driving controller is also compatible with the games Destructor and Dukes Of Hazzard.

Source: Wikipedia, "Coleco Vision", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

111004.name: ColecoVision Expansion Module #3
111004.description:
Expansion Module #3, the final hardware expansion module, was released in the summer of 1983. Module #3 converts the ColecoVision into a full-fledged computer known as the Coleco Adam, complete with keyboard and digital data pack (DDP) cassette drives. Module #3 was originally conceived to be the ColecoVision Super Game Module using game wafers as the storage medium. Although Coleco presented a mock-up of the SGM at the 1983 New York Toy Show, that product was never manufactured. There were also rumors that Expansion Module #3 was to have incorporated an RCA CED player to store larger amounts of data.

Source: Wikipedia, "Coleco Vision", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

111005.name: ColecoVision Roller Controller
111005.description:
The Roller Controller has a trackball packaged with a port of the arcade game Slither, a Centipede clone and meant to be used with some dedicated games like Victory or to enhance the gameplay of previously published cartridges which benefitted from its trackball system (like Wargames).

Source: Wikipedia, "Coleco Vision", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

111006.name: ColecoVision Super Action Controller Set
111006.description:
The Super Action Controller Set resembled a pair of boxing gloves, each with joystick and numeric keypad on top and a series of buttons along the grip. It came with the game Super Action Baseball and saw later release of the Rocky-inspired Super Action Boxing and a port of Front Line.

Source: Wikipedia, "Coleco Vision", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

111007.name: Play Ball!
111007.description:
Play Ball! is a dice game consisting of 3 dice. The dice are wooden, six-sided and consist of the following faces:

Red - Hit, 2 Base, 3 Base, Out, Out, Out
Blue - Hit, Hit, 2 Base, Out, Out, Out
Green - Hit, Hit, 3 Base, Home Run, Out, 2 Outs

The rules are simple and consist of the following (taken from the rules sheet):

1. Roll out 3 Cubes and use Baseball Rules of Play.
2. Always read Cubes in same order.
RED-BLUE-GREEN
3. Tally runs on Score Pad for each inning.
4. When 3 Outs are made, player passes Cubes to other team or player.

The contents of the game are:

One small, plastic canister to hold the contents
One 2" by 3" rules sheet/score pad
Three dice (Red, Blue,Green).

111011.name: Mecho Wars
111011.description:
User Summary

War between the Winged Crusade and the Landians. Build up your forces and battle your enemy until one of you captures the other's headquarters or destroys their army.

111012.name: Ragdoll Blaster 2
111012.description:
User Summary

Updated sequel to the physics puzzler Ragdoll Blaster. Aim your cannon and shoot your ragdoll(s) through the puzzle to hit their target.

111013.name: Reiner Knizia's Topas
111013.description:
User Summary

Place domino tiles on a grid adjacent to at least one other domino and score points for grouping gems of the same color. But there can never be seven gems of the same color in a row.

Based on the boardgame of the same name.
http://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/40961/topas

111014.name: The Earth Shook
111014.description:
The year is 2164. Mankind has self-actualized enough to realize that we are creatures of violence. Centuries of denying one of our base instincts has not led to a more civilized society. Technological advances have given unprecedented scales of damage potential to our conflicts. In 2153, the Council of Restraint was formed in response to the particularly devastating aftermath of a conflict between the United African Republic and Pacific Rim Conglomerate. Three years later the Conflict Resolution Accords were ratified. Now when conflicts arise, the involved states or ideological groups can settle the dispute in a manner that mitigates widespread destruction. Large, mechanized military machines meet to do battle of epic proportion. These battles are waged in controlled arenas to contain the violence and damage. Armored Terran Systems Corporation manufactures base machines called Mechs and combatants configure their Mech with armaments and options in preparation for combat.

The Earth Shook is a game where each player assumes the role of a large mechanized military class robot. Where man once waged war across the globe on epic proportions, machines now resolve the conflict in controlled arenas. Build your machine, defend your ideology, and destroy the others. Be the last machine standing on the field of battle; to the victor go the spoils of war.

Players each receive a basic identical Mech from the factory. They have a set amount of points that they can use to buy modules for the Mech. These modules adjust the ratings for Evasion, Shields, Armor, Speed, Maneuverability, Weapon Damage, Rate of Fire, and more. Once the modules have been purchased, the Mech stats are adjusted to reflect the module choices and teh game can commence.

Game play is similar to RoboRally or Wings of War in that each player will select 6 Move/Maneuver actions for their Mech each turn. In this manner, a turn is played out in six rounds as the Mechs execute their programmed moves. Can you out-maneuver your opponent? Do you risk an all out frontal attack. Each player will approach the battle differently, hoping to draw upon the strengths of their configured Mech.

Build & Battle. The game is on...

111015.name: Shapium
111015.description:
User Summary

Slide your shapes into the matching holes in the background but be careful not to let the shapes touch or you lose.

111016.name: Urlaubsländerquiz Frankreich
111016.description:
Trivia game about France.
The game consists of 240 questions on 48 cards, in the categories Town and Country, Art and Culture, History and Modern Times, Food and Drinks, Sports, Leisure and Holiday as well as Demands, 5 questions and 1 demand per cards, in varying sequences. Correct answers ears souvenirs, demands must be fulfilled when possible and change ownership of souvenirs. One can only hold a limited number of souvenirs of a kind, or must exchange them. Whoever has the most souvenirs at the end of the game wins.

111017.name: Urlaubsländerquiz Österreich
111017.description:
Trivia game about Austria.
The game consists of 240 questions on 48 cards, in the categories Town and Country, Art and Culture, History and Modern Times, Food and Drinks, Sports, Leisure and Holiday as well as Demands, 5 questions and 1 demand per cards, in varying sequences. Correct answers ears souvenirs, demands must be fulfilled when possible and change ownership of souvenirs. One can only hold a limited number of souvenirs of a kind, or must exchange them. Whoever has the most souvenirs at the end of the game wins.

111018.description:

The game consists of 240 questions on 48 cards, in the categories Town and Country, Art and Culture, History and Modern Times, Food and Drinks, Sports, Leisure and Holiday as well as Demands, 5 questions and 1 demand per cards, in varying sequences. Correct answers ears souvenirs, demands must be fulfilled when possible and change ownership of souvenirs. One can only hold a limited number of souvenirs of a kind, or must exchange them. Whoever has the most souvenirs at the end of the game wins.

111019.name: Urlaubsländerquiz Italien
111019.description:
Trivia game about Italy.
The game consists of 240 questions on 48 cards, in the categories Town and Country, Art and Culture, History and Modern Times, Food and Drinks, Sports, Leisure and Holiday as well as Demands, 5 questions and 1 demand per cards, in varying sequences. Correct answers ears souvenirs, demands must be fulfilled when possible and change ownership of souvenirs. One can only hold a limited number of souvenirs of a kind, or must exchange them. Whoever has the most souvenirs at the end of the game wins.

111020.description: Knights and ghost hold a race on the sides of the box, in the bottom of the box the castle is put over one of the quiz pages, windows of the castle show 4 correct and 4 wrong answers to the question on top of the page. Depending on the roll of the die one may move knight or ghost or put a chip on a correct answer. Can be played by one person alone.
111020.name: Entdecke die Ritterburg

111021.description: A trump and guessing game on 32 horse races, the cards show a number range, the name of the race, the size and weight of the animal, the colours of the coat and the age of the race. The cards are dealt, in his turn a player rolls the die and depending on the roll he chooses a very big or a very small number from the information on his cards, the next player answers with his biggest or smallest number in the same category. The player with the highest or lowest number respectively wins both cards. If one player has run out of cards, the player with the most cards wins. Packed in a belt bag, with key ring horse pendant.
111021.name: Wissensquiz Pferde

111022.name: Positronic Bridge
111022.description:
User Summary

Positronic Bridge represents a classic game of bridge with several difficulty settings and options. The player will have the chance to master the basics of bridge and beyond, as well as get a real feel of the game.

111024.description: A trump and guessing game on 32 kinds of predators, the cards show a number range, the name of the animal, the size and weight of the animal, the kind of protection it is awarded and the feed of the animal. The cards are dealt, in his turn a player rolls the die and depending on the roll he chooses a very big or a very small number from the information on his cards, the next player answers with his biggest or smallest number in the same category. The player with the highest or lowest number respectively wins both cards. If one player has run out of cards, the player with the most cards wins. Packed in a belt bag, with a predator tooth on a cord.
111024.name: Wissensquiz Raubtiere

111025.description: A trump and guessing game on 32 mammals, the cards show a number range, the name and the weight of the animal, its life span in the wild and the breeding time. The cards are dealt, in his turn a player rolls the die and depending on the roll he chooses a very big or a very small number from the information on his cards, the next player answers with his biggest or smallest number in the same category. The player with the highest or lowest number respectively wins both cards. If one player has run out of cards, the player with the most cards wins. Packed in a belt bag, with a thermometer.
111025.name: Wissensquiz Säugetiere

111026.description:
Opération Husky, Sicile 1943 (Operation Husky, Sicily 1943) covers, for two players, the campaign for Sicily in 1943 on a map divided in zones.

Scale:
- One turn for 3 to 5 days
- Units are divisions (with some regiment and brigade for special cases)

Scenarios:
- One historical campaign game
- One "what if?" scenario featuring an alternate landing zone.

The game uses classical principal with in addition GQ support, random events and optional rules.

It includes:
- A3 map
- 101 die cut counters
- rule and scenario booklet

Available with French rules, but English rules can be downloaded from Vae Victis website.
111026.name: Opération Husky, Sicile 1943

111027.description: A trump and guessing game about birds, the cards show a number range, the name of the race, the size and wing span of the bird, its life span in the wild and the hatching time. The cards are dealt, in his turn a player rolls the die and depending on the roll he chooses a very big or a very small number from the information on his cards, the next player answers with his biggest or smallest number in the same category. The player with the highest or lowest number respectively wins both cards. If one player has run out of cards, the player with the most cards wins. Packed in a belt bag, with a bird whistle.
111027.name: Wissensquiz Vögel

111028.name: Memeopoly
111028.description:
Memeopoly is a fun social drinking game which isn't complicated and doesn't require you to memorize or agree upon the rules.
The object of the game is simply to have fun with your friends and have a few drinks. You are able to quantify a victory by choosing to play with certain rules.


How to play:


Draw a card.
Do what the card says.
Discard the card.
Next Player’s turn.



The game ends when you run out of cards or find a special “Win” card near the end of the deck.
The text on the cards range from taking drinks, listing categories of objects, attempting physical feats, speaking in funny accents and deck manipulation.

There are several different ways to play including mechanics of hand management, point accumulation and just playing for the sake of playing the different cards.


Game details:


Players 3-10.
Age Range: Drinking age and upwards.
Duration: 30min to 2hrs depending on player count and number of cards.
Complexity: Easy to play, no complicated rules. Remove certain cards to customize gameplay.
Decks: Available in decks of 52 cards, every card is unique with a unique rule. Currently two decks are available.



More info:

You can try the game, download the print and play version of the game for free, or purchase a deck from games official website.

111030.name: Alle meine Tiere
111030.description: Each child has ist own picture of a farmyard, the missing animals are only visible in contours. To make it easy to find the missing animals, the conturs are coloured. All 24 animals are put into a bag, and players take turns to pull out an animal from the bag. On each card 6 animals are missing, players must pay close attention which animals are pulled out of the bag, since the animals have different colors on each picture. On one the duck is red, on the next one yellow, and so on. Only animals in the correct color count, who is the first to fill his picture with all the missing animals, wins.

111035.name: Aventures Extraordinaires & Machinations Infernales
111035.description:
From the Back of the Book:

From 1850 to 1870, the vast world is still unknown and the modern world's inventions flourish. It's the time of colonies and explorers, of the first anarchists, of the steam machine and electricity. A world where dreams about the Nautilus and travelling around the world in 80 days are possible.

rpgitemversion: Cyber Age 30 minutes in the future
111036.name: Cyber Age (1st edition)
111036.description:
From the Back of the Book:

Vous avez aimez Blade runner, New York 1997, Outland, Warriors, Tron, Total Recall et Max Headroom. Découvrez Cyber Age le monde tech de l' Europe de 2080.
User Translation into English:

You loved Blade Runner, New York 1997, Outland, Warriors, Tron, Total Recall and Max Headroom ? Discover Cyber Age, Europe tech world in 2080.

Second edition was published as a Casus Belli special issue in 1995.

111037.name: The Guildsman (Issue 7 - Fall 2000)
rpgissuearticle: Review: Guardians of Order’s Tenchi Muyo! RPG
111037.description:
The Guildsman
Issue #7
Fall 2000

First issue originally released in PDF format

Cover by "Stride"

111038.name: Salada de Silabas
111038.description:
This in an educational game from Brasil. The child attempts to match images of fruits and vegetables by combining two beautifully illustrated cards. Each card contains 50% of the object and 50% of the name.

The cards fit together like two halves of a puzzle to form a complete image, so the child learns by trial and error as the game progresses.

A successful match helps the child learn the word for the object and teaches the child how the fruit or vegetable appears in the natural world.

Includes 22 cards, rules, and a storage insert.

A solitaire option is available.

111039.name: Colonial Wars
111039.description:
Sci-fi miniature wargame set in a cruent XII century universe. Players engage in battles on planet surfaces commanding armies belonging to several warring parties, such as Terrax (humans), Torek and Sarmath.

The game is designed for quick matches which usually does not exceed one hour in duration. Battle resolutions are calculated using just 6-sided dice. Victory is achieved by fulfilling randomly-selected objectives which are defined at the start of the game (one main objective and several secondary ones). During a game players alternate in activating one unit each until all of them have moved and a game turn is completed. Each unit can execute up to 2 orders with an activation, while elite units can execute up to three actions with a single activation.

Colonial Wars is played using 20 mm custom miniatures (unpainted), available in thematic blisters.

111040.name: A Routine Operation
111040.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a standard Living Spycraft mission for a team of up to six 2nd level agents.

Not all adventures begin in glamorous fashion. Espionage agencies perform a wide variety of relatively unexciting activities on a daily basis, from long-term low-importance surveillance to record sweeps to casual tails targeting unimportant suspects. Most agents consider these tasks to be mind-numbing drudgery and avoid them at all costs. Unfortunately for new recruits, this is precisely the type of operation that the Agency assigns low-ranking agents, hoping to cut their teeth before sending them on matters of global import. (The Agency also assigns these missions to experienced agents with poor performance records, as well as those who arouse the ire of their superiors.)

The agents begin this serial assigned to just such a mission.

111041.name: Agent Down
111041.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a standard Living Spycraft tournament for a team of up to six 1st-level agents.

In addition to their opposition to subversive global espionage
groups, Agency operatives also work against more mundane foes such as organized crime cartels. Many of these groups can serve as fronts for unknown foes, and even those who don’t can generate tremendous sums of illicit funds that almost inevitably make their way to the Agency’s enemies in some form. Ultimately, the opposition of the criminal element serves as a preventative measure for the Agency.

One of the most effective means of deterring criminal elements
is by infiltrating them. As the premiere covert operations network in the world, the Agency has little difficulty finding suitable agents for such infiltration missions.

111042.name: The Beast of Dunvegan
111042.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a standard Living Spycraft tournament for a team of four to six 3rd-level agents (though the serial’s challenges and XP rewards are tiered so that the serial can be played by up to six agents of levels 8, 13, or 18 as well).

Dunvegan Castle is situated north of Inverness in the Scottish Highlands. The Ministry of Defence (MOD) uses the castle as a facility for weapons development and testing. The only civilians who live close by are the inhabitants of the small fishing village of Fuilden. The locals know that the castle is a military installation, but are encouraged to believe that it’s a remote listening post for monitoring communications. Lt. Colonel Fraser Campbell, an officer of the Highlanders Regiment, commands the facility.

Efforts at the facility are being focused on development of a resonance weapon. A breakthrough has recently being made by Dr. Roger Bainbridge, a chief scientist on the project, making construction of the weapon viable. This work is very high security, as the UN has strict restrictions on developing this type of weapon, and the MOD would rather they didn't find out. Unfortunately, Professor Norman Whyte, the project's other chief scientist, is a double agent. Recruited several years ago into W.A.R.D. (Worldwide Alliance for Regional Domination), Prof. Whyte has informed his superiors of the existence of the weapon.

111043.name: Black Tie Formal
111043.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a standard Living Spycraft mission for a team of up to six 2nd level agents.

The fall of Communism and the subsequent rise of Democracy throughout Eastern Bloc nations led to a time of both unprecedented growth and nearly inconceivable poverty. Today, within the halls of government and industry, powerful leaders wallow in opulence while outside their doors, peasants line up for food and drink rations.

One of the greatest sources of wealth throughout the Eastern Bloc is the stockpile of military weapons and vehicles housed within each of the countries that now occupy the former Soviet Union. Auctioned off to the highest bidder, these weapons — including chemical and biological arsenals capable of mass destruction — now regularly fall into the hands of those willing to use them for their own diabolical needs.

111044.name: Double Blind
111044.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome back, agents… As you know, the Shop's defection last year was a major blow to the Archer Foundation, and more specifically, the Company. My predecessor as Control of this organization, Dennis Gray, led the betrayal; worse, the Company is now riddled with Shop moles. Thanks to our compromised security, mounting operations against the Shop in Company territory is difficult at best, explosive at worst.

Fortunately, we've caught a break. Recently, another of our field teams shut down a Shop operation in San Francisco. The fallout of that incident has afforded us with our first real chance to take the fight to the enemy.

Unfortunately, I can't tell you more than that at this time. Even here, at the Kennel, there’s a chance the enemy has eyes and ears about, and I’m not willing risk tipping our hand before we’re ready to ante up. Within this packet are the details of Operation: TURNABOUT. The security tape is not to be removed until you are en route to your destination. Your pilot will be briefed about your target destination once you are in the air.

We've got the tiger by the tail agents: for once, we have the initiative.

Don’t blow it.

111045.name: Empty Houses
111045.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a standard RPGA Network tournament for a team of four to six 3rd-level agents (though the serial’s challenges and XP rewards are tiered so that the serial can be played by up to six agents of levels 8, 13, or 18 as well).

The late Sir Walter Wainwright the First was owner and founder of Wainwright Pharmaceuticals, a British company providing new and innovative pharmaceutical products. His death led to a lack of direction within the company’s ranks, and threatened bankruptcy unless the Board of Directors could locate a legitimate heir to the magnate’s fortune. Then an investor discovered an estranged son, Walter Wainwright II, who was institutionalized as a boy after poisoning his high school chemistry class. The heir’s therapists believed he suffered from severe delusions and sociopathic behavior, and had all but locked him up and thrown away the key.

The Board of Directors arranged for the heir’s release, planning to use him as a pawn, a figurehead who could lead the company into a new golden age of investor-controlled profit. But Walter Wainwright’s progeny took charge of his new position, leading the company in an entirely unexpected direction. Fascinated by war, he ordered the secret development of a variety of chemical weapons for eventual sale to the military.

111046.name: Fashion Victim
111046.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a standard RPGA Network tournament for a team of three to six 4th-level agents (though the serial’s challenges and XP rewards are tiered so that the serial can be played by up to six agents of levels 9, 14, or 19 as well).

Two years ago, the Agency assigned an undercover agent, Eric Sienski, to infiltrate a ring of Russian arms dealers. When Sienski repeatedly failed to make contact with his handler, Control assumed he was dead or worse, turned. In fact, Sienski was still active, but tight security protocols and the remote location of the ring’s headquarters in heartland Russia made communication needlessly risky.

Now, Sienski has decided to blow his cover and flee with information that the ringleader, Aleksei Kamenev, is in contact with a French research lab that's accidentally discovered a new type of nerve gas. Looking for a quick cash-out, the lab's head scientist, André Gauthier, has placed the accidental discovery on the black market. Kamenev has placed the highest bid, but before the deal is sealed, the ringleader has requested a full-scale demonstration of the gas's effectiveness — at Paris' Fashion Week, where the world’s most famous designers present their new collections to the upper crust of high society.

111047.name: Fire From The Ice
111047.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a standard RPGA Network tournament for a team of four to six 3rd-level agents (though the serial’s challenges and XP rewards are tiered so that the serial can be played by up to six
agents of levels 8, 13, or 18 as well).

With the assistance of an innovative Icelandic physicist, Dr. Brinn Gunnarsson, an international terrorist named Patrick Boregy has developed a weapon with which he intends to threaten the leaders of the free world. The weapon harnesses the heat of a volcano, projecting the captured energy in a laser-like beam that can shoot down aircraft. Boregy’s first target is the President of the United States, who is due to fly to Russia for a meeting of the G8 consortium of “the most powerful nations of the world” in a few days’ time. Once Air Force One is literally melted out of the sky, Boregy intends to demand that the remaining G8 leaders accede to his demands to drastically reduce globalization and greenhouse emissions… and, of course, to provide him with large sums of money and immunity from prosecution.

111048.name: Escape From Thel-Kadra
111048.description:
From the Introduction.

North of the Cradle of Life, near the Trachan Steppes, the Keza-Drak have begum a crusade to hunt down and capture the elusive Narmrothan Horse Lords. They bring back slaces to encampments in the southern part of the steppes, where the Sundaari Blood Lords perform dark and twisted rituals on them.

111049.name: FlashPoint
111049.description:
From publisher blurb:

"Ten hours ago, a U.S. spy plane was shot down by an unknown aggressor somewhere south of Japan. The home office believes this aggressor to be one of our long-time rivals: the Crimson Dynasty. Based on early intelligence, we believe the spy plane caught sight of an operational prototype of the Dynasty’s new sea-borne weapons platform, codenamed MANTICORE. We must know if the platform is operational, as obtain its current coordinates. Unfortunately, the Japanese are refusing to release any information about the crash until the plane’s pilot, Captain Robert McDonnell, is back in U.S. hands.

"Your mission is to infiltrate the U.S. Embassy and interview Capt. McDonnell before he's escorted home and out of our reach. There are two complications. First, the international media has been alerted of the incident, and are swarming around the Embassy, seeking a story. Our presence in Tokyo must remain as discreet as possible. Second, the Dynasty may know it was observed, and may try to silence the Captain before he can reveal MANTICORE's position. You are authorized to use lethal force only when Dynasty involvement is confirmed, and you're to do everything in your power to keep the Embassy safe from harm.

"The Captain departs the Embassy at 6 a.m., Tokyo time. You have 12 hrs. Good luck, agents."

111050.name: Knightmare II: The Maze of Galious
111050.description:
User Summary

In this 1987 mythological platform game the player controls Popolon and Aphrodite after the events of Konami's 1986 fantasy shooter Knightmare. The evil cleric Galious has kidnapped their unborn child Pamperse, and the pair must traverse the monster filled Castle in an attempt to find him. The player must collect and purchase a wide variety of items that improve their abilities and find the 10 hidden Worlds in the Castle. The thrust of the game is to solve puzzles, explore, and defeat the 10 demons that rule the hidden Worlds.

Character death is permanent, though there is an in game mechanic that can revive each of the characters once per game. However, the game features a save mechanism and the usefulness of a second life bar is often enough to warrant reloading a previous save game in the event of character death. Though there is only a single save point there is an item (obtainable near the outset of the game) that can warp the player to the screen containing the save point.

A fan remake of the MSX game (for PC, Mac, Linux) with a wide variety of graphical/musical options was released as a freeware download circa 2004.

The Famicom port is essentially a different game though it has many recognizable elements in common with the MSX game.

111051.description:
From the publisher's website:

DR - Halfaya Pass (DR-HP) - Halfaya Pass is another GSI offering using the Death Ride game system. The game focuses on tactical level combat and maneuver during Operation Battleaxe prior to the Crusader battle that lifted the seige of Tobruk. This is a stand alone game and does not need any other GSI title to be played. It is slightly larger than Hafid Ridge in terms of the number of units and can be played in a relatively short time.

This game will give those with the Death Ride Kursk games a glimpse into some changes for the next large series, Death Ride Salerno. This game will have double sided counters. A real advancement for us.

The rules are modeled around the seven battlefield operating systems which make them easily understood and easy to learn.

This battle will provide a challenge to both players. The British will find that they need to be very aggressive to push through the anti-tank defense. The Germans have to simply hang on. Either way it's a cliff hanger. The British Matilda's are the queen of the battlefield, until they meet the 88's.

Game play is excellent for solitaire play and moves along very quickly. The game is specifically designed to play in a day.

The Commonwealth forces were made up of 3 infantry battalions and a squadron and a half of Matilda tanks, heavy but undergunned and underpowered.
111051.name: Death Ride: Halfaya Pass

111052.name: Quidnam
111052.description:
Find answers to eternal questions or get insight into burning issues such as life, the universe and everything, whether the earth will exist in 2013, or what really happened to Atlantis. Quidnam is not just a game; it’s a mirror on life and the totality of human existence.

Quidnam is a unique card deck that can be used for contemplation and illuminating solitaire meditation or in a groupthink party game. The heart of Quidnam is the deck of 64 insightful cards developed from fundamental principles of human existence using Set Theory. Each card has lore and art to provide verbal and visual suggestions as to their meaning. There are 4 suits of 16 cards. These suits represent the 4 planes of existence - physical, biological, cognitive, and social. Each plane (suit) has 4 unique elements and a color; each card in the suit is composed of a combination of those four elements from zero to four. The mix of elements is shown on each card.

Meditation. To meditate, simply decide on a topic, shuffle the deck, deal some cards using a pattern or method to your liking, and study the result. You can do this alone or with family and friends. Some patterns for reading are shown in the action shots. You can create your own patterns and methods. The topic is up to you.

The Quidnam deck can be used to play the Groupthink game. This party game is best played with at least 4 players; the more the better. A question or issue is chosen at the beginning of play. Play consists of one or more rounds. For each round, one player serves as a judge. The role of judge rotates from round to round. Shuffle the deck and deal some cards using a pattern or method that the group likes. All players look at these cards and develop a secret reading which they write down and give to the judge. The judge picks the best reading and the winner gets a point. Several rounds should be played. The player with the most points wins.

Important note. Quidnam forms the foundation for the exciting game of Totality.

Totality also shows how the set theoretical design maps the cards to the I Ching and Zodiac.

111053.name: Maze of Galious
111053.description:
User Summary

Maze of Galious represents a remake of Konami's 1987 release Knightmare II: The Maze of Galious in which you play Popolon on a quest to rescue fair Aphrodite from the hands of evil Hydnos. Greatly improved graphics have placed this platform shooter into the new century. There are many levels, more enemies and powerful bosses. Additionally, you can buy and sell weapons from the in-game shops.

111056.name: Battle Bands
111056.description:
"Collect, Stretch & Destroy!"

Battle Bands is a collectible elastic band game where players build armies and take turns flicking them at a board. When two opposing bands touch, they "battle" using the corresponding character cards to see who wins. The game ends when all players have depleted their armies,and the points are tallied based on where their bands are on the board.

The elastic bands are shaped like different creatures, and come in red, blue and green. Each elastics' corresponding card has a strength level for the creature, and players build armies up to a certain level (for example, if they are "brawling, each player's army will consist of creatures totaling a strength of 50).

In addition, each player may add one black elastic band to their army. These black creatures have special abilities which will affect the board.

The game draws heavily from Magic: The Gathering for theme, and from Heroscape for building your army of bands.

111058.name: Waidmannsheil
111058.description:
Objective:
be the first to cross finish line

Simple 'Roll and Move' game, with - of course - nice drawings and individual meeples (hunter)
To increase possible target buyers it was recommended by the
German hunting organisation (see sticker)

111059.name: Operation: Gamma Raid
111059.description:
From publisher blurb:

First run at the Spycraft launch party at the 2002 GAMA Trade Show, this rapid-play demo includes a brief serial, sample characters from the Shadowforce Archer world setting, and a sheet of cut-outs for tactical movement. Runs in 2 hours or less; perfect for quickie demos anywhere.

111060.name: Ground Truth
111060.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a standard RPGA Network tournament for a team of four to six 3rd-level agents (though the serial’s challenges and XP rewards are tiered so that the serial can be played by up to six agents of levels 8, 13, or 18 as well).

For many years, the Western powers have been convinced that North Korea is developing clandestine nuclear weapons, despite both opposing treaty obligations and vehement denials. In August 1998, U.S. sources identified a potential site for the manufacture, testing, and storage of such devices at Hagap village, in P’youngan Pukto Province. Further investigation and evidence presented to the international community by the North Koreans showed that whatever was going on in Hagap, it wasn’t the construction of a nuclear reactor or any other processing plant necessary to develop nuclear weapons. Suspicions were transferred to another location — Kumchangni — which was the subject of diplomatic debate for several years before.

Now, the name ‘Hagap’ has re-emerged on the world stage. Recent satellite imagery has shown that work has intensified at the location, and the U.S. government has announced to the United Nations Security Council that a major threat exists and must be dealt with.

111061.name: Lockdown
111061.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a standard RPGA Network tournament for a team of four to six 2nd-level agents (though the serial’s challenges and XP rewards are tiered so that the serial can be played by up to six
agents of levels 7, 12, or 17 as well).

The Agency “administrator” known as Asylum — the “Ninth Man” and head of Agency internal security — is in fact a traitor within the organization. As a member of the Invisible Hand criminal organization, Asylum obtained his position through blackmail and coercion, and has since used his position to conceal the Hand’s activities as they acquire advanced technology.

Now, the Invisible Hand is ready to make a major worldwide move against the Agency, but requires one final piece of technology — an Agency decoder unit. To acquire this device, the villains target the Agency’s San Francisco base of operations, a communications hub for its U.S., Pacific, and East Asian offices. They must take care to ensure that the Agency doesn’t discover that its device has been stolen, or the codes will be changed. The Hand’s solution is to destroy the base during the theft — along with everyone in it.

111062.name: Living Spycraft MRD V1.7: Rules
111062.description:
From Introduction:

This document provides instruction for creating agents in the Living Spycraft game environment and guidance for players and judges when participating in Living Spycraft events.

Living Spycraft adventures (referred to as "serials") follow the standard RPGA format, being grouped into single round (4 hour) and two-round (8 hour) events. Each player should have an agent sheet and a career dossier prepared before an event begins, as well as any other required documents (as determined by their agent history and the rules in this document).

111063.name: Living Spycraft MRD V1.7: Tables
111063.description:
User summary:

A collection of tables to assist players and judges for the Living Spycraft campaign model to easily locate information.

111064.name: Living Spycraft MRD V1.7: GC Info
111064.description:
From Introduction:

This document provides GC material supporting Living Spycraft events. For agent creation instructions and general rules, see the primary Living Spycraft Master Rules Document.

111065.name: Back to Basics
111065.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome, agents… Yesterday, several thousand pounds of rocket fuel went missing from a joint European Union military installation in El Molar, Spain. This would not normally fall under our purview but with the International Space Station close to completion and a new global satellite data feed planned to go
on-line in three days, it becomes critical that we know what — or who — we’re dealing with.

Your mission is not only to recover the fuel, but also to track those who stole it and determine their intentions. If they are a danger to us, or the world, you are to shut them down using any means necessary.

As usual, the agency will deny involvement, but you can expect our support throughout — and the usual assortment of advanced experimental gear, of course…

Good luck, agents, and God’s speed.

This serial begins at a remote installation in Spain where a mystery hides a dangerous plan of global import. Agents travel to Caen and then Deauville, France, and finally to Kinbrace, Scotland, where a new threat lurks, waiting to send the world collapsing back into a new Dark Age.

111066.name: Lider (Número 21 - Enero 1991)
111066.description:
SUMARIO

EL estado de la afición
La Biblioteca de Ankh-Morpork
Consultorio de Orco Francis
Silencio se juega:
Third Raich
Flechas contra Corazas
Quinta flota
El Rincón de Europa
Reino Mágico

Plomo en las mesas
La batalla de Cardedeu

Dossier
Tac Air

La voz de su Master
El vampiro en la llamada de Cthulhu
Idioma en el James Bond 007
Los secretos del Diablo

Módulos
El Señor de los Anillos
Aquellarre
La llama de Cthulhu

111067.name: One Minute to Midnight
111067.description:
From publisher blurb:

In 1947, the “Doomsday Clock” debuted on the cover of The Bulletin of the Atomic Scientists. Set at seven minutes to midnight, the clock would track the likelihood of a nuclear exchange. Quickly, the clock became a symbol of the nuclear age: a bogeyman for the modern man.

In 1949, the hands of the clock moved for the first time as the Soviet Union tested their first nuclear weapon. Three minutes to midnight. Four years later, as the Soviet Union and the United States each developed the thermonuclear bomb, the clock moved again. 1953 had arrived, and it was two minutes to midnight. Since then, the "Doomsday Clock" has never come closer to midnight.

Until now.

A madman’s plot threatens to plunge the world into a nuclear exchange, and only you can foil his scheme. In this serial taking the agents from a nuclear missile silo in the American Midwest to a hidden stronghold on a secret island in the Bermuda Triangle, a former American intelligence agent plots to spark one last battle with his old enemy, the Great Bear Russia. And he’ll force the United States to fight on his behalf.

It is one minute to midnight. Can you stop the clock?

111068.name: Snake Bite
boardgamefamily: Games by the Game Artisans of Canada
111068.description:
Players play as snakes competing to collect eggs scattered across the board. Every time you eat an egg, your snake grows longer. Watch out, though; snakes can eat each other's tails, so a long snake is a tempting target!

Points are awarded for eating eggs and other snake's tails. A balance of both is usually needed to win.

111069.description:
AIM OF THE GAME

Obtain magical points (MP) by preventing evil creatures from invading the human world. These creatures come from the underwater Ker-Ys city.

PREPARATION


In turn, the players place all elements of the game area (wall ruins, swamps).
Four creatures are introduced in the game and will progress from the door (in the centre of a glade) towards either side of the game board (representing the druids’ path surrounding the glade). Creatures’ moves are pre-defined and happen automatically.
The players place their team of three druids whose role is to prevent the creatures from invading the human world.
Energy markers are set at the start level and the knowledge track markers are set under the tracks.
The pile of Power cards is shuffled and placed near the board.


THE GAME

The game consists of a defined number of rounds (depending on number of players). Every round is composed of the following phases:


The creatures progress. The creatures already on the board progress towards the side of the board using a totally automatic way of moving. New creatures (1 to 3, depending on a dice roll) arrive on the board and start to progress too.
Preparation of the Action tiles. The six Action tiles are shuffled and placed one by one forming a line, face up. These tiles represent all possible actions, each tile being separated into a major and a minor action. The number of places available on the tiles depends on the number of players.
Choice of actions. Each druid team carries out 5 actions a round, represented by Action markers. Players, in the reverse order of their position on the score track, choose their actions one by one by setting their Action markers on the available places on the Action cards. Actions can be: moving the druids (they only move on the path surrounding the glade), setting a magical stone (a magical stone is set at the intersection of the magical beams emitted by two druids looking at the glade, this costs energy; the magical beams do not cross obstacles), capturing creature(s) (a druid may capture a creature in front of him with his magical beam; this costs energy but gives MP and sometimes special properties), progressing in knowledge tracks (to increase the capacity of moving, or to increase the influence at the druid council, for ­instance), preparing magical beverages (to increase knowledge but also to recover energy), moving a magical stone (it is possible to move a magical stone), acquiring Power cards (they give special powers, such as allowing the magical beam to pass through a wall), and influencing a creature (allows to move a creature).
Actions are performed. Actions are performed marker by marker, from left to right, starting with the major actions before doing the minor ones. If the same colour of marker is encountered a second time on the same action, this action is not carried out. The actions on the next Action tile are then carried out and so on, until all major or all minor actions have been performed. Then, the players come back to the stopped action to perform it. Druids must inform the council about all their actions. After they have set a stone, captured a creature, or prepared a magical beverage, druids are placed at the druid council. Any druid can start from the council to enter back the path, but he can also stay at the council to influence it and gain MP at the end of the round.
Activation of magical stones. At the end of each round, all stones that are aligned and of the same colour automatically become menhirs. MP are attributed to the corresponding players and depend on the distance between the stones that have been transformed, as well as their position in the glade. Menhirs have a special property that will be activated at the end of the game.
Druid council. At the end of each round, the influence of each druid team on the council is evaluated. Players receive as many MP as their number of druids at the council. In addition, the team in majority can increase his knowledge in one of the knowledge tracks.


Then, a new round can start.

END OF THE GAME

The game is finished after 5 or 6 rounds, depending on the number of players. In addition to the MP gained during the game, players receive MP according to the magical stones still on the board and the Power cards still in their hands.
Also, the final menhir layout is important and can afford MP according to two different scenarios. If the central door (from which the creatures come) can be completely shut in by drawing a connecting line between menhirs, then MP are attributed to the players for the menhirs they have placed in the glade. If it is not possible to shut in the central door by connecting menhirs, then MP are attributed to the players for the creatures that they have captured.

THE WINNER

The winner is the player with the highest MP score.
111069.name: Karnag

111070.name: Tales from Wilderland
rpghonor: 2013 Golden Geek Best RPG Supplement Nominee
rpgissuearticle: Der Eine Ring: Geschichten aus Wilderland
111070.description:
Publisher blurb:

Wilderland awakens! With the threat of Smaug removed and the Misty Mountain Orcs driven back into their foul mountain holds, the Free Peoples are seizing the opportunity to reclaim the region. Kings extend their realms’ boundaries, merchants open up trade routes to long-sundered markets and previously strained relations blossom into true alliances.

At the forefront of this resurgence are adventurers. Whether they are rediscovering isolated communities, battling the remnants of the Shadow or exploring the land and opening it up for others to follow, groups of Heroes are proving instrumental in the taming of the Wild.

Tales from Wilderland contains 7 adventure scenarios for The One Ring: Adventures Over the Edge of the Wild, the fantasy roleplaying game set in the world of The Hobbit and The Lord of the Rings. The scenarios can be played individually or as part of a linked campaign.

111071.name: 101-In-1 Party Megamix
111071.description:
The game features three different modes: TV Guide, Zapping, and Marathon. Featuring eight differently-themed channels, TV Guide mode challenges players to beat high scores to unlock more games and earn bonus prizes to decorate their player profiles with. Zapping mode provides instant access to any currently unlocked game. Up to four players can join the party in Marathon mode where everyone plays five randomly selected games in a row and competes for the highest score. Players can take on the one hundred and one challenges alone to access every last game, or make it a family competition, and see who can unlock the most games. Up to four profiles can be saved per console so each player's individual progress is maintained.

Source: Wikipedia, "101-in-1 Party Megamix", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

111072.name: Alien Vs. Predator: The Last Of His Clan
111072.description:
User Summary

You are the last of your Clan of Predators. Your mission is to rid the ship of Aliens or die trying.

111073.name: AMF Bowling 2004
111073.description:
AMF Bowling 2004 is a bowling video game released exclusively for the Xbox in the US on November 14, 2003.

Source: Wikipedia, "AMF Bowling 2004", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

111074.name: Ape Escape 3
111074.description:
Though its gameplay is similar to its predecessors, Ape Escape 3 features new changes to the series. The game allows the player to choose between a playable male character (Satoru) and a playable female character (Sayaka) at the beginning of the game (they play the same, though some story cutscenes differ). It centers on one of the two playable characters venturing throughout television programs to capture invading monkeys. There are now 442 monkeys to capture in this game. While there are less gadgets in this game than previous entries, a new feature in this game is the ability to morph into different outfits through a device built by Aki. Another addition to the game is "Monkey Steal!" If you attack a monkey too much not only will it try and face you head on, it may even steal a Gotcha Gadget. If that Gadget is the net, the player may get caught and will be brought back to the hub (The game treats you as though you had used Escape by letting you keep all the monkeys that were caught, returns any stolen items, and you do not lose a life from it). The stun club and the monkey net are the only gadgets that can get stolen. Also unlike Ape Escape 2, there is monkey radar data for Specter and the Freaky Monkey Five. This also doesn't have the Magic Punch unlike the other Ape Escape Games.

Source: Wikipedia, "Ape Escape 3", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

111076.name: ATV: Quad Power Racing
111076.description:
ATV Quad Power Racing is an all-terrain vehicle racing video game released in 2000 for the PlayStation and in 2002 for the Game Boy Advance. There are two sequels released: ATV Quad Power Racing 2 and ATV: Quad Frenzy.

There are four gameplay modes: championship, single race, time attack, and two-player. In championship mode there are six different playable characters to choose from and twelve tracks to race on. The tracks are separated to three different themes: desert, forest and snow. Objective is to win first place against five other computer-controlled opponents. In the time attack mode and the single race mode objective is to record a high score by time or place respectively. Two-player mode is a race between two human opponents in split screen. The game also features weather effects.

Source: Wikipedia, "ATV Quad Power Racing", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

111078.name: Puz-L-Game
111078.description: Puz-L-Game is basically a 21" x 14" puzzle divided into four color-coded triangle sections. The instructions for the game are printed in the center of the puzzle on a 24-piece white oval. They instruct 2, 3, or 4 players to each collect one color-coded section of the puzzle (96 pieces) prior to the game beginning. Then players compete to see who can complete their section of the puzzle first. There are two themes I am aware of: African Animals and Race Cars. The African Animals Puz-L-Game consists of a blue rhino, a red elephant, a yellow lion, and a green gorilla

111079.description: 20 animal cubes are placed within the board, white side up. In his move a player determines a starting animal by placing his chip on the cube. The colour die determines the category, speed, breeding time, size, weight or age, the Symbol die determines whether the chosen animals must be stronger or weaker in the category than the starting animal. All players in turn take one cube till all pass, then first the active player and then all others compare the colour codes of the chosen animals - for correct choices they move 1 spot forward, for a wrong choice 1 spot back. Dog spots on the scoring scale earn a point for actions, rabbit actions earn one point for the active player if he finds out which animal cube was removed behind his back.
111079.name: 3 mit Kopf & Pfote: Wettbewerb der Tiere

111080.description:
Mondo Micro is a 2 player Expansion for Mondo.

The new player board lays between both players and will be played with the "first-time" rules, unless the timer will be set upon 3 minutes only.

The board has two different player boards (double-sided)

It also contains a small variant: Before a round choose 2 identical tiles (various animals are allowed). Place one with random direction on one of the fields which differs to the colors of the other fields. The second player has to use the 2nd tile in the same direction.

The playerboard was available at Essen fair 2011.
111080.name: Mondo Micro

111081.description:
Animal Upon Animal: Crest Climbers uses the same basic gameplay as Animal Upon Animal: Each turn a player rolls the die and either places one or two animals on to the stack of animals, passes one of their animals to another player for them to place, or places an animal on the table, extending the base for other players to build upon. Of course, if any pieces fall off whilst you are building, you get up to two of them back. The first player to have used all of their animals wins.

Animal Upon Animal: Crest Climbers, first released as Tier auf Tier: Gipferstürmer, features animals and objects native to Switzerland.
111081.name: Animal Upon Animal: Crest Climbers
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 107-- Gen Con 2015 Wrap up and La Granja Review
GenCon 2015 - HABA USA
TPGC - Episode #66 - Animal Upon Animal, Animal Upon Animal Crest Climbers and Spinderella
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 76
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 77!

111083.name: Polski Film: gra planszowa
111083.description:
Playing the "Polish film" refers, its rules to known educational game "Poland: Questions and Answers". In this quiz, you will find a social game, 1800 questions about Polish film. Questions are divided into six categories: film before the year 89, the film after year 89, the creators and actors, quotes, series / animation and different category. Double-sided game board also allows you to play a version of the party, in which you must do one of the tasks involving random draw, showing or describing your team password associated with the film. To win you need not only knowledge but also a bit of luck.

400 card,
double-sided board,
6 checkers,
36 chips,
dice,
Sandglass,
instruction.

111086.name: The Phantom League: Mostly Harmless Promo Deck
111086.description:
Set of 9 promo cards for The Phantom League: Mostly Harmless.

The set includes:
2 Improvement cards (I55 ZPG Special Edition, I57 Shielded Hold Mk1),
1 Docking card (D34 Special Occasion),
1 Pirate card (P14 "The Lure"),
1 Hyperspace card (H24 Dark Matter),
1 Captain card (C13 Inquisitor Alysha),
1 Mission card (M36 Holy Relic),
and
2 Battle cards (B87 Hail Mary, B88 Gatling/Jam)

111090.name: Kiddie Quiz
111090.description:
A game to help 'Tiny Tots' to recognise names and objects. A question sheet is laid over the mechanics. On the left there are 3 pictures per line, making 12 pictures altogether per sheet. On the right are 12 boxes with the names of the objects. A child must touch an object with the lead and then touch the name. If correct, bulbs will light up.
When played competitively, the first one to get a pre-set number of questions right, wins.

111091.description:
A Monopoly clone set in the coastal town of Wilhemshaven, Germany. The game has sponsored by a local radio station and by various Wilehmshaven entrepreneurs, the players have to acquire and trade company shares instead of streets.

The penalties for players ending their move on an already occupied field only increase with the number of company shares with identical colors; the concept of additional buildings such as hotels been dropped. Instead, this game features profit and loss statements that are triggered by certain fields. They change share values, resulting in players paying money into or getting money from a money pool. There are also pool cards triggering the profit and loss statements of shares of one color.
111091.name: Das Wilhemshaven Spiel

111092.name: Treasure Vault
111092.description:
From the Front Cover:

A collection of 26 unusual items with 38 interlocked personalities in 57 suggested scenarios for any role playing game system

From the Back Cover:
A game-master's aid for all role-playing systems

You've trudged through miles of wilderness, crossed the swamp to end all swamps, fought creatures of the night and monsters of madness and you still have a light purse? Then unlock the doors to Treasure Vault!

These unique items, magical and otherwise, provide a fresh lure to exciting adventures for the most jaded character's sprit. The unusual personalities and tantalizing scenarios make this book a genuine treasure trove of ideas for the game master of any role playing system.

111093.name: People, Places, and Things: You are here
111093.description:
From the Back Cover:
You are here!

Contained within are 29 different modern locations complete with full-color maps, descriptions, regular, and plenty of plot hooks all in a system neutral format so you can use it with any game you choose.

Not only that, but every map in the book can be printed out as a 1 inch scale battlemat, perfect for that next adventure.

111094.name: Middle-Earth Play-By-Mail
111094.description:
Middle-earth Play-By-Mail is an award-winning strategic game set the world of J.R.R. Tolkien's Middle-earth. In it, you take on the role of the heroes (and villains) of Middle-earth, leading armies, undertaking perilous adventures, governing your cities and towns, and making all the decisions that affect your empire.

Middle-earth Play-By-Mail is a team game, where you work together as part of either the Free Peoples in defending the innocent against Sauron's hatred, or as a Dark Servant, a hand of Sauron.

Middle-earth Play-by-Mail is a turn-based game. This means that rather than playing online, you have the luxury of time in which to consider and plan your next move, before submitting your new orders.

111095.name: Outback Interlude
111095.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a standard RPGA Network tournament for a team of up to six 3rd-level agents (though the serial’s challenges and XP rewards are tiered so that the serial can be played by up to six agents of levels 8, 13, or 18 as well).

There is growing disquiet within government and security circles about the number of military-grade weapons finding their way into terrorist hands. Recent intelligence suggests that two individuals control a large proportion of this trade — an international arms dealer named Terrance Adams and a shady figure by the name of Lothario Lex.

Adams is well known within the arms trade, and ostensibly lives on the right side of the law, observing government restrictions and selling only to buyers with recognized “enduser certificates." He lives a playboy lifestyle in Australia, spending freely on his main passion — horse racing. When not at the races, Adams is usually to be found on his outback ranch, where he conducts most of his business.

111096.name: Outbreak
111096.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a standard RPGA Network tournament for a team of four to six 4th-level agents (though the serial’s challenges and XP rewards are tiered so that the serial can be played by up to six agents of levels 9, 14, or 19 as well).

This Living Spycraft serial is a crossover with the Stargate SG-1 universe and several events and characters derived from the series. The main “villains” presented here are the replicators, which first appear in the third season Stargate SG-1 episode, “Nemesis.”

Previously, in episode 3.22: “Nemesis” and 4.1: “Small Victories,” the Asgard vessel Biliskner crashed into the Pacific Ocean 400 miles off the coast of California, with both the replicators and the Stargate Command (SGC)’s Giza Stargate aboard. Several replicators survived the crash and took over the Russian submarine Blackbird. While SG-1 members dealt with the alien threat, the Russian Navy swept the ocean and secretly recovered the Stargate (believed by the Americans to be destroyed). The Russians also recovered three damaged replicators and slipped them into stasis before they could revive. Although the SGC later learned the Russians held the Giza Stargate (in episode 4.7: “Watergate”), they as yet remain unaware the Russians possess replicators as well.

111097.description:
In the 'Villains and Vigilantes Card Game', players take on the roles of the supervillains trying to carry out a variety of sinister schemes or the heroes striving to bring them to justice.

This game, with characters and themes drawn from the classic superhero RPG, offers the entire comic book experience. It has dastardly plans, bold escapes, secret identities, craven henchmen, brave saviors of defenseless citizens and super powers beyond imagination. All this comes from a streamlined strategy game that can be played in under an hour.

Each player controls one or more superheroes or supervillains and has a custom card deck based on the super powers their characters possess. Players play mission cards that indicate their characters' goals and win conditions. There are plot cards that establish unusual items or significant events going on in the city. Power cards are played to soar or streak from one location to the next, blast your enemies, escape from danger, or display your uncanny abilities.

Players race to complete their missions, thwart their archenemies, and win the day.
111097.name: Villains and Vigilantes Card Game
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 93- Clank! and The Dark Side of Gaming: Obsession

111098.name: Barbie Horse Adventures: Blue Ribbon Race
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Advance edition
111098.description:
User Summary

The goal of the game is to win all four different cups in order to help the world's horse adoption situation. In order to win the races, you must maneuver Barbie and her horse around both racetracks and obstacle courses. You can also try to collect the letters of Barbie's name to add time to the timer. There are points in certain races where Barbie will have to dismount her horse to safely cross bridges.

There are also a number of mini games that can be played with 2 players:

-Maze Valley

-Horseshoes.

-Happy Trails.

-Shoe Shuffle.

111099.name: Barney's Hide & Seek Game
111099.description:
In this game, the objective is to move Barney around four themed levels and locate five children and five presents that are hiding throughout the level. Unlike action games, the player is not allowed to die (a lack of a proper health bar also indicates Barney's inability to die). Should the player find all the children and presents in different levels, they would be rewarded with a "special surprise". During the surprise, the purple balloons are popped while confetti and streamers are drizzled in the presence of excited children in addition to Barney and Baby Bop. Barney's Hide and Seek has a certain medieval/fantasy look because modern technology does not appear in this game.

When nowhere near an object to interact with, Barney can blow kisses in the air complete with flying heart symbols. Locating a child results in giving him or her a hug. Barney can even fly on balloons, float on clouds, and jump on nearby platforms. Sound quality can be questionable on certain parts; "fish" tends to be one of the words that the game has trouble vocalizing correctly. The inability for Barney to die is indicated by him refusing to fall off floating platforms; instead there is a safety lecture handed out by Barney so kids can learn to be careful like him. Cloud jumping is only possible when the traffic light is showing a green signal.

Source: Wikipedia, "Barney's Hide & Seek Game", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

111100.name: Beyblade: G-Revolution
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Advance edition
111100.description:
From the Back of the Box

Explore an entire Beyblade world, where you'll challenge the greatest Beybladers and collect valuable parts! Sharpen your battle skills on your quest to become World Champion!

111101.name: Bicycle Casino
111101.description:
Box description:

Texas Hold'em is sweeping the world and it's now available online LIVE for you to ante up and get in on the action. Bicycle Casino will keep everyone from the novice to the shark on the edge of their chairs with fast-paced action and over 500 different game variations to choose from. So pull up your favorite chair and get in on the action today!

111102.name: Bionicle: Maze Of Shadows
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Advance edition
111102.description:
User Summary

A top down action adventure game with turn-based combat. You control six Toa Metru heroes who must find the power to awaken their sleeping people.

111103.name: The One Ring Dice set
111103.description:
Cubicle 7 store website:

This set contains the seven dice found in the The One Ring core game - six 6-sided Success Dice and a 12-sided Feat Die - packaged in a sturdy plastic box.

111104.name: Board Game Classics
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Advance edition
111104.description:
Box description:

Chess! Checkers! Backgammon!

Timeless games meet today's technology, in this inviting collection of classics from DSI Games. Themed characters fight animated battles on your chess board, as you engage your friends in multi-player games. Switch off rules, and play variant versions of the games you grew up with. Easy, Normal, and "Impossible" levels makethese games fun and challenging for everyone!

Choose a character and battle other theme characters in tournaments where the pressure and the difficulty levels mount! Explore Fantasy, Science Fiction and Atlantis modes while you challenge your friends or the computer to some stimulating fun! Loads of great play features make this a "must have" for your Game Boy Advance collection! You'll love these versions of your all-time favourites!

boardgamehonor: 2013 Golden Geek Best Thematic Board Game Nominee
111105.description:
A STORYTELLING BOARD GAME SET IN THE 1970s COLD WAR ERA.

SMERSH is a portmanteau of two Russian words that translates to "Death to Spies." It operated as a counter-intelligence agency by the Red Army during the 1940s. Despite having had a large number of paid employees, little was known about the agency until recently when Russia opened their archives.

Agents of SMERSH is a cooperative Storytelling game that pits players as UN Secret Service Spies set in an alternate 1970s timeline against a newly formed and independent SMERSH. Agents of SMERSH includes custom dice to determine success or failure of encounters, and more strategic play from what is typically expected of a Storytelling board game. There are plenty of James Bond gadgets, guns, cars, pop references and detailed artwork - not to mention a touch of humor. The game features the artwork of George Patsouras (The Resistance & Flash Point).

The game is able to accommodate play with either The Encounter Book, which contains over 1500 written encounters with a similar reaction matrix to Tales of the Arabian Nights - or played more simply with only encounter cards with shorter encounters and no matrix. The First Edition (2012) of the game came with the Encounter Cards as standard, and the Encounter Book as an optional add-on (although many copies did actually include the book). The Second Edition (2015) includes the Encounter Book as standard, with the Encounter Cards available to purchase from the publisher.
111105.name: Agents of SMERSH
boardgamepodcastepisode: Agents of SMERSH vs. Tales of the Arabian Nights
Episode 13 - Couples Night
Episode 34 - Race the Hardline
GenCon 2014 - Agents of SMERSH
OBG 114: I'll Place My Worker Here

111106.name: The Tufty Game
111106.description: A simple roll and move game. If you land on an instruction, you must obey it. This was the first Spears game featuring Tufty the Squirrel.

111107.name: Speedboat Racing
111107.description: A simple race game. Throw dice and move, and obey any instructions

111108.name: CART World Series
111108.description:
This game is licensed and features many notable drivers from the late 1990s, such as Greg Moore, Al Unser Jr. and Paul Tracy. The game also features 10 authentic tracks as well as realistic handling and damage. Players can compete in a full year's worth of races competing for points in each race or in simple single races. There are two game modes: arcade and simulation. Arcade mode allows re-spawning of damaged vehicle parts. In Simulation mode, all damage is permanent for the race. The game supports the analog controller.

The play can make many modifications to a car's performance. The player can: adjust the tires to fit the road (hard for ovals or soft for road courses), as well as modify gear ratios and aerodynamics. Moving the front of the car down or slanting the wings may enable the player to find a perfect combination of speed and handling. During simulation mode races, the car's tires will wear down and fuel will deplete (both can be replaced by a pit stop).

In addition to the real drivers and cars (Honda and Ford included), ten official CART tracks have been included – each modeled after its real-life counterpart. Tracks span the United States and are located in Cleveland, Michigan, Long Beach and more. Each features realistic dynamics and road handling in an attempt to create a believable racing experience. In Season Mode, the player will take part in a series of races, for which the player must qualify and race, earning points toward a cup.

Source: Wikipedia, "CART World Series", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

111109.name: Cartoon Network Speedway
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Advance edition
111109.description:
Cartoon Network Speedway is a kart racing video game released for the Game Boy Advance in 2003.

Source: Wikipedia, "Cartoon Network Speedway", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

111110.name: Castlevania: The Adventure ReBirth
111110.description:
The Adventure ReBirth consists of six areas that the player has to complete in order to finish the game. Toward the end of each area is a boss the player has to defeat before advancing to the next stage.

The player's main weapon for attacking in-game enemies is a whip, which can upgraded by collecting orbs. Unlike the original Adventure title for the Game Boy, there are secondary weapons that are referred to as sub-weapons, which are required to use with items called hearts. There are five available sub-weapons and each have a different use.

Source: Wikipedia, "Castlevania: The Adventure ReBirth", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

111111.name: Poisoning the Well
111111.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a standard RPGA Network tournament for a team of four to six 4th-level agents (though the serial’s challenges and XP rewards are tiered so that the serial can be played by up to six agents of levels 9, 14, or 19 as well).

Walter Wainwright the Second is the insane, bankrupt owner of Wainwright Pharmaceuticals, whose latest drug makes people believe they’re migratory birds. Wainwright uses this “Avis drug” to re-establish himself as a financial power, and to gain revenge upon the shareholders who abandoned him.

In the previous Living Spycraft serial, Empty Houses, Wainwright infected small villages in Southern England and hired gangs of thugs to clean them out. The agents were called in to investigate the most recent attack, in Wivelsfield Green north of London, and likely captured one or more of Wainwright’s henchmen in the process.

Today…

Three mercenary henchmen assist Walter Wainwright — Dominic Bender, a former MI5 operative, Arcadia, a smalltime thief and Wainwright’s opportunistic lover, and “The Faceless,” a fanatically loyal cult of hired killers. In the aftermath of “Empty Houses,” Bender and Arcadia are both likely captured and the Wainwright Pharmaceuticals home office is raided. The intelligence gleaned from this operation leads directly into “Poisoning the Well”.

111112.name: Chess, Bridge, & More
111112.description:
User Summary

A compilation of various classic games.

111113.name: Remember Remember
111113.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a standard RPGA Network tournament for a team of four to six 4th-level agents (though the serial’s challenges and XP rewards are tiered so that the serial can be played by up to six agents of levels 9, 14, or 19 as well).

This serial is the culmination of the W.A.R.D. Off Evil mini-series, which focuses on the Worldwide Alliance for Regional Domination (W.A.R.D.) and its efforts to obtain a super-weapon. In this mini-series’ first Living Spycraft serial, The Beast of Dunvegan, W.A.R.D. tried to steal an experimental
resonator weapon from the British Government. After that effort failed, the organization set up a secret laboratory in Malta to produce a retrovirus capable of killing thousands (see The Maltese Experiment). Fortunately, a defecting W.A.R.D. agent briefed the Agency, allowing one of its agent teams to shut the laboratory down before catastrophe struck. Finally, in The Yellow Submarine, the agents recovered the HMS Sea Lion, a British nuclear submarine, but failed to bring home her dangerous payload. That payload is the focus of this serial.

W.A.R.D.’s European commander, Sir Simeon Smythe, poses as a senior civil servant in the British Ministry of Defence. He plans to detonate his newly acquired warhead at a London conference for European heads of state, scheduled shortly after the opening of Parliament. He expects that in the ensuing crisis, W.A.R.D. will swoop in and seize command of the stunned nations targeted by the attack.

111114.name: Chicken Little
111114.description:
The film spawned two video games. The first, Chicken Little, is a 2005 action-adventure video game released by Avalanche Software.

Source: Wikipedia, "Chicken Little (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

111115.name: SFA Shadow Bios
111115.description:
From Introduction:

An infrequent section of some Chamber Books was the "Shadow Biography" - sidebar material intended to extent the Shadowforce Archer canon with stories about some of its most illustrious personalities. Unfortunately, the section was never included in any printed book for space reasons. Here we present all the shadow biographies prepared for the line. Enjoy!

111116.name: Shallow Graves
111116.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome, agents… We have a situation in the U.S. One of our Company specialists, NSA Analyst Dr. Ryan Forsythe, was killed
when a freak electrical surge detonated the personal computer in his home study. The resulting fire spread quickly, consuming everything in his office. But we believe that his most critical findings are hidden somewhere in his day station, suite 14 of the Rivercrest Fellowship.

Rivercrest is a front for NSA research staff who sift through unconnected data brought in by U.S. field agents. Dr. Forsythe occasionally mirrors their findings to us.

We believe that Dr. Forsythe stumbled onto a Shop operation, and that he was killed before he could transmit the information from his home.

Your mission is to infiltrate the Rivercrest facility and determine what Dr. Forsythe found. Establishing the cause of his death is equally vital.

We can only assume that Dr. Forsythe’s death has attracted the attention of NSA intelligence, who are unaware of our network or Forsythe’s link to us. You are to avoid detection at all costs.

That’s all agents.

Don’t make a mess.

111117.name: Skylanders: Spyro's Adventure
videogamehonor: 2012 D.I.C.E. Best Gameplay Engineering of the Year Nominee
2012 D.I.C.E. Best Innovation of the Year Winner
2012 D.I.C.E. Family Game of the Year Nominee
2012 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Innovation of the Year Nominee
111117.description:
The game is set after the events of "The Legend of Spyro: Dawn of the Dragon". In Skylanders: Spyro's Adventure, players take on the role of a powerful Portal Master who can control over 32 different characters, including the fire-breathing dragon, Spyro. Players will embark on a fantastical journey into an amazing world, where they will explore mysterious, mythical lands, battle menacing outlandish creatures, collect gold and treasures, and solve interesting puzzles while on a quest to save their world from Kaos, an evil Portal Master, that they must defeat.

Source: Wikipedia, "Skylanders", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

111118.name: Contender 2
111118.description:
Box description:

Are you a contender? Train to improve your technique and timing and then work your way up the ranks against brutal competition to become the boxing world champion!

111119.name: Perplexus Rookie
111119.description:
Perplexus Rookie - The Baby of the Perplexus Family

Perplexus Rookie will introduce you to the three dimensional, gravity defying world of Perplexus challenges. Flip, twist and turn the sphere to navigate the steel ball along the numbered tracks through 75 barriers of varying difficulty. Perplexus Rookie is easy to play but still challenging to complete. A domed finish keeps the ball in place at the end to secure your success! Fun for the whole family. 6 1/2" in diameter.

* Flip, twist and turn the sphere to solve the puzzle
* Easy to play but challenging to complete
* Improves hand-eye coordination and spatial relations
* Develops motor and dexterity skills
* Great for travel - no loose pieces

111120.name: Castrol Honda: World Superbike Team – Superbike Racing

111121.name: Retro Entertainment System
111121.description:
User Summary
