The Retro Entertainment System is a third-party game console which allows players to play their old NES cartridges. Unlike the original system, it does not have a regional lock-out setting, so NES games released in other parts of the world are fully compatible. It comes with two special controllers which add a slow feature and turbo versions of both the 'A' and 'B' buttons. In addition, it is compatible with other NES controllers as well. The console is a top-loader like most cartridge-based consoles which were released after the classic NES.

111122.name: Counter Force
111122.description:
Box description:

Every day, thousands perish. Those who survive share rumors of an alien entity called "Diadora". The survivors took refuge below the earth's surface, narrowly escaping the alien invaders. The governing Council ordered an immediate counterattack. The primary objective codenamed: "Counter Force" would reclaim the earth's surface using 3 experimental robots. The secondary objective is to investigate the alien war-machine and defeat the mysterious "Diadora". Three freedom fighters - Sophia, Dynamis and Calista are humanity's last hope for victory!

-Fast and furious 3D shoot'em-up style, with powerful weapons.
-Up to 12 different enemies and 5 different bosses.
-Shop to upgrade your robot's features and build your strategy.
-Original soundtrack with high-energy beat keeps pace with the intensity of the action.

111123.name: Crash Bandicoot Purple: Ripto's Revenge
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Advance edition
111123.description:
Crash Bandicoot Purple: Ripto's Rampage and Spyro Orange: The Cortex Conspiracy are single-player side-scrolling adventure games in which the player controls Crash Bandicoot and Spyro the Dragon in the respective games. While the games feature platforming elements that allow Crash and Spyro to navigate different areas, the main focus is on a series of minigames that make up the core of the gameplay. The minigames involve distinctively different gameplay elements, such as destroying enemies in a Breakout-inspired challenge or racing through an area with a jet pack, tank or inner tube. The games make use of the Game Link Cable, allowing players to compete in multiplayer versions of several of the minigames found in the games. Much of these minigames only require one copy of either of the games for as many as four players in the network. Players can earn trading cards by performing specific tasks; these cards can be traded between Game Boy Advance systems to players who do not physically own a copy of the games. Additional content can be accessed if the two games are linked to each other.

Source: Wikipedia, "Crash Bandicoot Purple: Ripto's Rampage and Spyro Orange: The Cortex Conspiracy", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

boardgamehonor: 2012 Golden Geek Best Print & Play Board Game Nominee
111124.description:
WELCOME TO DARK MOON. The Noguchi Masaki interplanetary mining corporation welcomes you to its outpost on Titan, the dark moon of Saturn! You will be joining an experienced crew of miners, technicians, and adventurous souls who live to experience all the wonders that our solar system has to offer. Purpose, loyalty, camaraderie, friendship, and sacrifice all await you as a new and valued member of the Noguchi Masaki family!

DARK MOON (formerly known as BSG Express), is a game of deception and betrayal at the cold edge of space.
You are a crew member on a deep space mining expedition to Titan, the dark moon of Saturn. During a routine excavation, an “incident” occurs whereby some of the crew become infected with an unknown virus, and become paranoid, deceitful, and violent, trying to destroy the others.

At the start of the game, players are divided into two teams: Uninfected and Infected. The Uninfected team simply needs to survive until the end of the game, while the Infected team secretly attempts to destroy them. Each player knows which team they are on, but does not know which team the other players are on! Who is your teammate and who is your enemy? Can you trust your best friend? And why doesn’t anyone trust you when you tell them you’re one of the good guys?!
Roll dice, overcome traumatic events, throw your friends in quarantine when you don’t believe them, and (if you’re Infected) betray everyone at just the right moment to secure victory!
111124.name: Dark Moon
boardgamepodcastepisode: Dark Moon
Ep 28 Stronghold Games Publishing With Stephen Buonocore
Episode 13 - Uniquely Scary Games
Episode 16: Kings of Air and Steam, Tremors, and Loots and Legends
Episode 53- Elysium and GenCon 2015 Preview
Episode 54- GenCon 2015 and La Granja (Plus a CONTEST!)
Episode 56- Rattle, Battle, Grab the Loot and Gaming Relationships
Episode 66- Dark Moon and Relationship Games
Episode 7 - Spiel des Jahres
Episode 9: Panamax, They Live, and Solforge
GenCon 2015 - Stronghold Games
I've Been Diced! episode 71: Mutants, game studies, and 2015 in review
MN 0065 Looking Back and Looking Forward
MN 0087 Dark Moon
MN 0112 Dan Wells Discusses Narrative Games
The Good, The Board and the Passed to the Left: Episode 21 “Drafting”
The Good, The Board and the SPECIAL EPISODE!!
The Long View: Coup
Vox Republica 088: Con Season Anticipation
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 28!!!

111125.name: Heavy Metal: Geomatrix
111125.description:
Heavy Metal: Geomatrix is a fully 3D arena fighting game released in 2001 by both Sega and Capcom for the Sega NAOMI and Dreamcast, based upon the Heavy Metal license.

Using similar perspective and control scheme to Capcom's Spawn: In the Demon's Hand, the game presents up to 4 players combats in large arenas in what is seen as a follow up to the basics of Capcom's Power Stone series, although more oriented to weapon fighting/shooting and a serious and dark cyberpunk tone because of the Heavy Metal universe setting. The game features a soundtrack of licensed music by artists such as Megadeth, Halford, W.A.S.P., Corrosion of Conformity and Dust to Dust. A soundtrack CD featuring songs used in the game as well as songs from other artists was released by Sanctuary Records to tie in with the game.

Source: Wikipedia, "Heavy Metal: Geomatrix", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

111126.name: Combat Storm (Second Edition)
111126.description:
The 2nd editon of COMBAT STORM is a turn-based miniature wargame where players use green and tan plastic army men as their game pieces and a large playing area, such as a living room floor or large table as their battlefield!

What started out originally as an expansion pack, quickly turned into a full-fledged new edition packed full of exciting new rules, soldier classes, vehicles, and gameplay mechanics.

There were too many cool new things we wanted to explore, that an expansion pack just wouldn't do it justice.

111127.name: Hover Force
111127.description:
Hover Force is a video game published by INTV Corporation for the Intellivision video game system in 1986. The game was initially developed by Mattel Electronics with the intent of it being played in 3-D, but the company was shut down before it could be released. INTV, after acquiring the Intellivision assets from Mattel, re-tooled the game, which pits players against a terrorist group laying siege to a city, and released it itself.

Source: Wikipedia, "Hover Force", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

111128.name: Chasing a Golden Buck (HERO)
111128.description:
From the first page of the module
A Module for 2-5 Characters
HERO 5th Edition Revised: Valdorian Age
Module Overview
Not Official Hero Universe Material
This scenario is an officially licensed product of bot the Hero System and of the Valdorian Age Setting. The contents are not part of the Official Hero Universe and are not in any way port of official cannon.

A few notes for module preparation.
This module is designed for two to five players utilizing 150 points characters(75 Base + 75 Disadvantage)
PCs in The Valdorian Age have a base of 8 for their characteristics instead of the normal 10, and all skills of the pregenerated character fall below the Normal Skill Maxima threshold.

111129.name: Renegade Ops
111129.description:
RENEGADE OPS™ puts players in a mobile commando unit sent behind enemy lines to defeat Inferno, a madman intent on global domination. Defeat enemies across a range of stunning environments using a wide variety of vehicles, from tanks armed to the teeth to fully loaded helicopters.

Players have the choice to fight alone in single player mode, team up offline with two-player split screen or join the dynamic 4-player online co-op experience. Blast your way through enemy lines by working together, or compete for achievements as you and your friends aim to top the online leader boards. Unleash your full arsenal of weapons and destroy anything that stands in your path as you battle to protect the free world in any way possible.

Madman Inferno, the commander of a sinister terrorist organisation, has detonated a devastating bomb to demonstrate the power of his new deadly weapon. Furious at the world’s leaders decision not to fight against Inferno, General Bryant has recruited a crack team of military specialists, known as the RENEGADE OPS, from around the globe to wage war against Inferno’s promise of world domination.

Source: The Game Website.

111130.name: Take On Helicopters
111130.description:
The brand new helicopter game from independent developers Bohemia Interactive – creators of the award-winning mil-sim series Arma 2.

Built upon over 10 years of experience in cutting-edge simulator development, Take On Helicopters immerses players within rich, expansive landscapes and authentic flight dynamics.

Take On Helicopters!

Take On Helicopters offers:

- High fidelity flight dynamics modelling
- Richly modelled helicopters & cockpits
- Expansive & detailed environments
- Powerful & intuitive mission editor
- Multiplayer – co-op & competitive scenarios

Take your first steps towards mastering rotor-wing flight across a massive range of enjoyable challenges, or create your own missions using the powerful easy-to-use mission editor.

Take to the air above two beautifully rich and expansive environments, based upon real-world North American and South Asian terrain-data.

Take on cutting-edge technology, helicopters modelled in stunning detail, a large-scale, open-world sandbox and authentic flight dynamics…

Take On Helicopters!

In the latest instalment of Bohemia Interactive’s line-up of immersive games, the player can enjoy several distinct gamplay modes, including:

- Free Flight
- Career Mode
- Challenges
- Time Trials
- Editor

Source: The Game Website.

111131.name: Family Vacation
111131.description:
The Simmons family are heading out to the sun-drenched shores of California and you have to help them get to their destination safe and happy. You’ll have to help them pack, get to the airport on time, board the plane, have a safe flight and get to their hotel at the other end. And that’s where the fun begins.

Hit the beach, take in a ball game, go to Playland Amusement Park – games, rides and the ultimate roller coasters and then help Barb compete on her favorite game show to win cash and prizes.

Source: The Game Website.

111132.name: Cardboard Heroes: Cavern Floors
111132.description:
From the Front Cover
83 Full-Color Rooms and Corridors
With 70 Assorted Skeletons, Pits, Treasures, and Monsters For Your Underground Exploring Pleasure

From the Back Cover
More Than a 10-Foot-Wide Corridor
Make your games more visual and exciting! Fill your table with cavers and corridors … at a bargain price. The Cardboard Hero Cavern Floors are marked off with squares grids on one side and hex grids on the other, so they'll work with any game system.

From Steve Jackson Games Web Site
Hot on the heels of the popular Cardboard Heroes Dungeon Floors comes a complete set of Cavern Floors. 16 sheets of caves, vaults, twisting passageways, pits, rockslides, and other underground formations to make your dungeon-delving come to life. Cardboard Heroes Cavern Floors also comes with "transition pieces" that let you connect your caverns directly to the previously-released Dungeon Floors.

Note from gamer
The page count includes the front and back cover.

111133.name: Ironclaw: Squaring the Circle - Host's Book
111133.description:
from the back of the book

Get ready for the bold new adventure in fantasy role-play!

Experience the rich and detailed world of Calabria, where dozens of species live together in sprawling cities and war-torn countryside. Kings broker for power with clergy, wizards, and merchants, each one struggling to conquer all they survey. Meanwhile, beneath the notice of the squabbling powers, lurk greedy robbers, cruel slavers, and dark necromancers who prey on the weak, the helpless, and the forgotten. It is a time for mighty warriors, for quick rogues, for clever wizards - a time for heroes!

IRONCLAW's unique system of dynamic combat allows players to work together to defeat enemies. Enjoy action sequences as fast-paced and exciting as any book or movie, where how the battle is fought is just as important as why it was fought in the first place. From the star chambers of political conspirators, who plot steal the kingdom... to dark and haunted places, where supernatural peril threatens the mortal world... or even to the humble streets, where an urchin picks the wrong pocket - adventure is everywhere, limited only by the player's imaginations.

Players may choose from dozens of species, careers, and special abilities. If you've never played a role-playing game before, you can make a few simple choices and play in minutes. Veteran gamers can delve deep into strange and powerful combinations, customizing every detail. You and your fellow players will create a party of adventurers, each with unique strengths to cover your friends' weaknesses, as you sally forth into a glorious new world of bold adventure.

This book is not a stand-alone game. The pages in this book start from where the IRONCLAW Player's Book ended - you will need the Player's Book or Omnibus to play. You will also need polyhedral dice (four-sided, six-sided, eight-sided, ten-sided, and twelve-sided).

111134.name: Ironclaw: Squaring the Circle - Player's Book
111134.description:
from the back of the book

Get ready for the bold new adventure in anthropomorphic fantasy role-play!

Experience the rich and detailed world of Calabria, where dozens of species live together in sprawling cities and war-torn countryside. Kings broker for power with clergy, wizards, and merchants, each one struggling to conquer all they survey. Meanwhile, beneath the notice of the squabbling powers, lurk greedy robbers, cruel slavers, and dark necromancers who prey on the weak, the helpless, and the forgotten. It is a time for mighty warriors, for quick rogues, for clever wizards - a time for heroes!

IRONCLAW's unique system of dynamic combat allows players to work together to defeat enemies. Enjoy action sequences as fast-paced and exciting as any book or movie, where how the battle is fought is just as important as why it was fought in the first place. From the star chambers of political conspirators, who plot steal the kingdom... to dark and haunted places, where supernatural peril threatens the mortal world... or even to the humble streets, where an urchin picks the wrong pocket - adventure is everywhere, limited only by the player's imaginations.

This introduction to IRONCLAW contains all the rules necessary to play the game. Players may choose from dozens of species, careers, and special abilities. If you've never played a role-playing game before, you can make a few simple choices and play in minutes. Veteran gamers can delve deep into strange and powerful combinations, customizing every detail. You and your fellow players will create a party of adventurers, each with unique strengths to cover your friends' weaknesses, as you sally forth into a glorious new world of bold adventure.

To play this game, you will need pencils, paper and polyhedral dice (four-, six-, eight-, ten-, and twelve-sided).

111135.name: NHL Hockey (Intellivision)
111135.description:
From the manual

OBJECT OF THE GAME is to score more goals than your opponent in three 20-minute periods. Each goal scores 1 point. No overtime. Tie-score at the end of 3rd period will stand. (All times are simulated.)

111136.name: Stellar Prospector
111136.description:
Stellar Prospector is a light game for 3-5 players vying for the chance to run a start-up franchise that prospects rare elements from stars in their planetary system. The first candidate franchisee to complete five specific delivery missions of specific rare elements to particular planets wins the right to run the franchise (and thus wins the game).

Players start the game with a small amount of money but no ships, pilots or fuel. In order to prospect and deliver rare elements, players must hire pilots and buy ships and fuel. Ships may be bought and pilots hired either at auction or from the shop. Higher level pilots and ships have a better chance of success but cost more money. Players make more money either by prospecting and delivering rare elements or bumming around the home base planet doing odd jobs.

Players must learn which stars contain what rare elements through trial-and-error missions and taking note of other players' routes and deliveries.

So players must balance observation with action, knowledge with uncertainty in their race to complete their missions, because star mining is a risky business, with pilot error or ship failure resulting in a fiery end to both.

111137.name: Unhallowed Metropolis (Revised)
111137.description:
from the back of the book

Unhallowed Metropolis is the gas-mask chic role-playing game of Neo-Victorian horror.

It has been two hundred years since first the outbreak of the Plague, when withou warning the dead rose to feed on the flesh of the living. Countless millions perished in the chaos that followed. It was the dawn of a new dark age.

London, the capital of the Neo-Victorian Empire, is a vast, densely crowded fortification. Beneath the towering walls and crackling Tesla towers, where the fallout of a thousand crematoria darkens the streets, ten million souls live in squalour. Predators, human and inhuman, stalk the slums and rookeries, preying on the unwary and the helpless. Driven by an insatiable hunger for immortality, physicians search tirelessly for the elixir vitae, the fabled alchemical solution that promises life eternal and a cure for the Plague. Above it all, the aristocracy looks down, pristine and enduring behind their walls of privilege, but preyed upon by dangers more insidious than those that infest the streets.

Even in this time of darkness there are those with the strength to fight. Undertakers, Mourners, soldiers, and scientists do battle with the horrors of the age, keeping a solemn vigil over the Unhallowed Metropolis.

111138.description:
Within the shadows of the wilds, events are set in motion that will bring the area’s powers into a desperate clash by which their fates in the west will be determined. As a returned hero prepares to enact an ancient ritual to foil the plots of dragons, the Skorne Empire resumes its march for conquest and the beleaguered United Kriels must outfox old enemies in their continued fight for the survival of their race.

HORDES: Domination heralds the next exciting chapter of the HORDES saga. Set loose the savagery of war with:
• New troops to bring to the fight, including ten new warlocks and the debut of the mighty battle engines.
• New narrative fiction, including compelling stories for each HORDES faction.
• A painting and modeling guide to help you ready your forces for battle.
• New Theme Force lists for each new warlock, which allow you to create armies based on specialized forces found in the HORDES world.
111138.name: Hordes: Domination

111139.name: Forged in Magic (Arcanis)
rpgsetting: Arcanis: The World of Shattered Empires
111139.description:
from the back of the book

Legendary Relics....

The tales of great heroes often speak of the miraculous relics they carry. The spark of creation, the very energy that formed the universe from nothingness, is gathered and focused by mysterious and dangerous rites of enchantment. The results are items of power such as those detailed herein.

...For Legendary Heroes

This book is an indispensable resource for Chronicler's and Heroes alike. These pages contain scores of magical items worthy of your heroes, as well as the runes and scrolls that are at the command of priests and sorcerers.

111140.name: It Pays to Advertise
111140.description:
Trivia party game featuring very famous advertisements and you have to guess the product. The guest who gets the most right, wins.

Each player receives a double-sided card with 18 clues to famous adverts in Britain in the 50's. Altogether there are 8 visual clues and ten written clues.

111141.name: The Television Grove Family
111141.description: Party game, a simple trivia game about Britain's first TV soap opera. The guest with the most trivia facts about this programme, wins.

111142.name: Zombie Town
111142.description:
A fast 3 to 6 player non-collectible card game where everyone dies, the "winner" is just the last person to fall to the horde. A turn comprises seven actions: drawing cards; (if applicable) perform a hiding test to determine if any location is retained; (if applicable) play cards to perform defensive actions or deploy locations; (if applicable) take explosion or infection tests; adjust health level; distribute zombies to other players; discard down to current hand size. When your health reaches zero you are out of the game and the last player with any health left wins.

The rules are simple and the game is quick to play.

The game blurb reads as follows:

"Suddenly a small town was attacked by unknown viruses; all of the people was infected and became zombies. Only a few people survive..."

The game is distributed by Swan Panasia Distribution.

111143.name: What's the Difference?
111143.description: A party game for the more observant guests. Everyone gets to see up to 12 pictures. Then, more pictures, with subtle differences are left where guests can see them, and they must write down what is missing from the second picture version. Whoever gets most right answers durin the evening, wins.

boardgamecompilation: Power Grid: BGG Promo Card Set
111144.description:
Power Grid: Theme Park (Funkenschlag: Freizeitpark) is a promotional card for Power Grid that was available for a donation at the 2F-Spiele booth during Spiel 2011. This card is also part of the BGG Promo Card Set.

The card is auctioned to the players immediately after it has been drawn. It counts as an additional city for its owner and not as a power plant.
111144.name: Power Grid: Theme Park

111145.name: The 64,000 Question
111145.description:
A party game for trivia enthusiasts. Volunteer guests are asked trivia questions and the guest who gets the most correct, wins.
Questions and answers provided by the Encyclopedia Britannica.
The box says it is related to the television show, but, as it is just quiz questions, the company could have said it was related to hundreds of other TV game-shows!

Note the odd title - not a pound or dollar sign at all.

111146.name: Spare Squares
111146.description:
A massive social-trading puzzle game designed for BGG.con 2011. The game was created using 5,000 unique square cards, each with a symbol on each edge and a number in the middle.

Each player is given four cards. The object is to trade cards and then arrange four cards into a highly-valued set, where points are awarded based on matching the colors, fillings, and shapes of the symbols on interior and exterior edges.

111147.name: Masterplan
boardgamepodcastepisode: Podcast #049 - Essen 2011 parte 2
111147.description: In Masterplan, players take turns placing houses onto a 8x8 square grid. Houses can be placed at the sides or in the corners of the squares. Whenever three houses are in a row (no matter in which colour combination), a green flat piece is placed at either end. Players who have the majority of adjacent pieces to these flat ones score at this moment. The majority depends on whether a house is placed on the line directly adjacent to this space (2 points) or at the corner (if diagonally adjacent, valued 2 points) or only on the adjacent space, but at another line or corner (1 point). Whenever a full square of houses could be build (3 houses creating an "l") a tower is placed onto the fourth space. These towers score only at the end of the game, depending on the majority around them.

boardgamehonor: 2012 Spiel der Spiele Hit für Familien Recommended
111148.description:
Würfel Bohnanza is, as you might suspect, a dice game in the Bohnanza family. Instead of cards, dice give you the beans that you must use to satisfy orders and (eventually) collect "Bohnentalers" (i.e., dollars, bucks, dinero...). The first player to collect thirteen Bohnentalers wins.

At the start of the game, each player receives two order cards, each of which shows six orders; the player tries to complete orders on one card while using the other to cover completed orders. The easiest orders to complete – say, two specific bean types or three beans in any combination of two types – are at the bottom of the card, and the hardest ones – requiring, say, a four-of-a-kind or seven beans with no blue ones – are at the top. Orders must be completed from bottom to top.

On a turn, the active player starts by rolling the seven bean dice, three of which have one combination of beans and four of which have another combination. This player must set aside at least one bean, then she rerolls any remaining dice, setting at least one aside, etc. After at most seven rolls, she completes as many orders as she can, reusing the dice as needed to complete orders. Once a player completes three orders, she can "harvest" the card for one coin. Each additional completed order is worth a coin, up to a maximum of four. When a player harvests the order card, she draws a new card and uses that to record completed orders (possibly on the same turn) on the order card she already had.

In the Bohnanza card game, players trade cards to improve the standing of both parties involved in the trade. In Würfel Bohnanza, the active player doesn't trade dice, but opponents do get to benefit from that player's rolls. After each roll by the active player, all other players can use the dice just rolled – and not dice already set aside – to complete orders on their own cards. Thus, the active player has some incentive not to dawdle too much with her rolls as her opponents might benefit from her turn more than she does.

The game ends as soon as one or more players have collected thirteen Bohnentalers. The player with the most Bohnentalers wins!
111148.name: Würfel Bohnanza
boardgamepodcastepisode: BGTG 122 - SR & Feedback (Würfel Bohnanza & Lords of Waterdeep)
Episode 20 - Geekway Games And Animal Facts
Episode 5: Around the World in 80 Days, Doomtown: Reloaded, Stone Age, Nippon, Wurfel Bohnanza
Episode 97-- March Madness Filler Tournament
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 82
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 85!

111149.description:
This small expansion was first issued as a promo item at the "Spiel 2011" in Essen.

These meeples can guard one of the 5 areas in the game from sabotage (except the barracks) once, moving along clockwise after it was used. If the player wants to protect a different area than the one to which the meeple was moved, he must pay 1 coin for each area the meeple is moved further.

Contents:


1 rules sheet
5 meeples (the Sentinels)
111149.name: Alba Longa: The Sentinels

111151.name: Helvetia: Wanderarbeiter aus Österreich
111151.description:
Migrant worker from Austria

This mini expansion adds a 6th character. This character gives the option to move a not married villager from a building to another free building or the town square at the cost of 1 coin.

This mini expansion was handed out for free by the Österreichisches Spiele Museum at Spiel 2011.

111153.name: HeiNasH
111153.description:
HeiNasH is a connection game with some luck.
Two players try to connect their sides with pawns, as in Hex game.
The board is made of hexes with numbers from 1 to 36.
The player roll three dice. He has now to create a number with the 3 results. If he find a solution, he places one pawn on the number found. If he doesn't find any solution, his opponent can show him one solution and he has to recover this number. If nobody find a solution, the active player places a pawn on any free number.

111155.name: TSL Shooting Game
111155.description:
A target shooting game. The target is three characters, on the end of a stand. The box illustrates this very well.
Players take turns and the one who has the most successes after a pre-set time has run out, wins

111156.name: Das Feuerwehrspiel
111156.description: There is a fire and the firefighters must help and need their equipment, helmet, axe, oxygen mask and hose. In his move a player rolls the die and moves his firefighter, several may meet on a spot. According to the kind of spot reached one can move the fire engine and thus receive equipment or one looses or gains equipment directly on meeting a firefighter. Who has collected all equipment and reaches the fire first, wins the game.

111157.description:
This Backgammon variant is based on an illustration of the games book of Alfonso el sabio X., dated around 1200. It is for 2 to 6 aged 8 and up.
Rules are very similar to Backgammon. 2 on a field are a block. You begin with your 4 pawns on your start field. You move with two dice clockwise. If you roll a double you can roll again after moving. In difference to backgammon you can only capture with the number on the red die or in combination with the red die. You must reach your start field with the exact number.
The flexible board is made by serigraphy and the 24 wooden pieces are hand colored. Other material is 2 dice and 6 target cards.
111157.name: Backgammon Circle

111161.description:
Big Boss is part of the Zooloretto-News No. 4, and is also available from www.zooloretto.com

Big Boss is a mini-expansion for Zooloretto Boss. It allows the players to buy different offices, to build over the normal offices, giving the player new options.
111161.name: Zooloretto: Big Boss

111162.name: Electro Star Finde das blaue Auto
111162.description: The child plays with elefant Milly and has the choice of two variants of the game, a discovery variant a quiz variant. In the discovery variant Milly demonstrates how to use Electro Star, the child gets familiar with the colour families - red, blue, green, yellow, pink, orange and white. Milly explains to the child what it sees and gives out the corresponding sound. In the quiz variant the child places a card and Milly asks for the corresponding second cards and gives out praise for a correct card.

111163.name: Electro start
111163.description: An electric first "computer" with 80 different lectures in several subjects, optical and acoustic signals stimulate hand-eye-coordination and an optical self-correction mechanism shows the correct answer after two false ones. The colourfully illustrated cards are numbered according to difficulty, a button lights up beside a question and the child has to press a button for an answer, correct and false answers are marked by different sounds. Who answers most answers correctly wins the game.

111164.description: The Bear family is having a few surprises, things are disappearing from their surroundings, leaving only white spots behind. Of course the bears try to remedy matters and to bring things back. The game consists of 12 picture cards with motives from the bear family life, on each card a simple geometric shape has been left unprinted. 24 forms, 12 red and 12 yellow, are sorted by color and put into a bag each. Cards are tourned over one by one and the players reach into their bags and try to find the necessary shape by touch alone. The player who is faster and produces the correct shape, gets the card, when all cards are turned over, the player with the most cards wins.
111164.name: Familie Bär

111165.description:
This is a promo card given away at SPIEL 2011 in Essen. It can be used only for Agricola with farmers of the moor expansion.

The "Biogasanlage" is another Major Improvement card placed at game beginning.

It costs 2 Stones and 1 grain to build.

The text says:

"You can swap grain from your storage to 2 fuel tokens at any time. You have to place this fuel tokens on this card. In the field phase, you can remove as much fuel tokens from this cards as you want and use them for heating your rooms. At the end of the game, you get 1/2/3 points for 3/5/7 fuel tokens on this card."
111165.name: Agricola: Biogas Plant Promo Card

111166.name: Fauna: Eierlegende Wollmilchsau & Innerer Schweinehund Promo
111166.description:
Two promotional cards for Fauna, given away at SPIEL 2011 in Essen.

As in the base game, every round a single animal presents itself by name and picture. The 2-6 players try to guess the animal's weight, length, height, tail length and - most important - the areas in which the animal lives on the Earth.

This expansion adds the two fictional animals "Eierlegende Wollmilchsau" and the "Innerer Schweinehund" (german common phrases) to the game.

111167.name: 10 Commandments Dominoes
111167.description:
This is a card game published by a church in Singapore, to teach players the 10 commandments and how they should be applied.

The 'dominoes' are cards divided into two squares, with a commandment (either the number or the text of the commandment), a name (of a person or place), an action or a picture (e.g. a golden calf). There are also two six-sided dice: one has the numbers, 1 to 6, the other has special symbols.

The 61 dominoes are dealt out evenly to all players (up to four) and the remaining card is placed face up in the middle. Players then try to lay dominoes down by matching them with the ends of the domino line on the table (like conventional domino games). Squares match if their content are related (e.g. the number of the commandment will match the actual words of the commandment). Any player can challenge a match, whereupon the person laying the domino "must explain himself with proofs from the bible or they can seek an outside moderator".

After making a match, the player rolls both dice to determine who will play next (based on the number rolled and the symbol that comes up).

The winner is the first player to finish all his or her cards.

111168.name: GOLD! Promotional Scoring Card
111168.description:
A new scoring card for another scoring variant.

Game setup:
After the cards on offer have been revealed: the player sitting right to the starting player chooses a scoring variant and places a coin on the correspponding spot.

Final scoring:
Depending on the scoring variant the following changes apply:

The player with the most donkey cards loses the game regardless of his victory points. In case of a tie all of those players lose,

Each set of red cards counts 15 victory points instead of the values of the cards.

Each "3" counts 9 victory points instead of 3.

111169.name: Tri-Pin
111169.description:
Objective: get your three pins in a straight line diagonally across the board
1 Each players places his three pins consecutive into the holes
2 Players move by turn (green/amber)
3 Move only, a pin may not 'jump'
4 The central hole may be occupied any time during a player's turn
6 Try to 'trap' your opponent's pins to get 3-in-a-line
7 Start a new game changing starting player

111170.name: The Eightfold Web
111170.description:
From the publisher:

Beware the web of Raknis, the shadowy spider god... the Eightfold Web! Agents of the sinister spider-cult are everywhere, doing their master's bidding. They may even be amongst those the heroes trust the most. What are the secrets of the mysterious Widow and the Lord of the Spiders, and what are the plans of their master? The Eightfold Web extends everywhere, and heroes are already caught in it! This product is for Mutants & Masterminds Third Edition.

111171.description:
The Last Will: Plan Order Board determines the player order for the placement of Planning Markers – which in turn determines the order for Errand Boy placement as usual.

At the start of the game, place a marker of each player's color on a random circle, using only those circles which correspond to the number of players. For the first round, the player order is 5,4,3,2,1; in all other rounds the order is 1,2,3,4,5. If you place an Errand Boy in the left gray circle (with a clock illustration), then your marker is placed on 1 and the other markers shifted right to fill the gap you left. Similarly, if you place your Errand Boy on the right circle, your marker is placed on 2 and other markers shifted right to fill any gap you left.

The Last Will: Plan Order Board was first released at Spiel 2011 as a promotional item.
111171.name: Last Will: Plan Order Board

111172.name: Crooks
111172.description:
New York, 1935 – You are a cunning top criminal with a plan that just can't fail. You need only a number of thieves and other scum to put these plans into practice. Fortunately, the city is packed with unemployed rogues who linger in bars, at pool halls and by the race course waiting for a chance to make easy money. Gather the best thieves and rob various locations in the city so as to go home with the most money at the end of the day.

In Crooks you assume the role of a mafia boss and want to use your thieves tactically to increase your earnings or to thwart others. To do this you must:


Look for the best thieves: Visit hangouts in the city and choose from the thieves available, taking into account that whomever you don't choose will work for your opponents!
Balance tactics and bluffing: The choice is yours ... thwart others or immediately carry out your own plans?
Use your cards wisely: Some thieves can also perform special actions, which increase your chances of winning.


The second edition of Crooks features a cardboard box (instead of a tin), updated cards (with some crooks having new ranks), the removal of the Kingpin, a changed pickpocket rule, and a new type of card: the Support Crew, which affects the rank of the cards on its left or right.

111173.description:
Everybody is fond of teasing and challenging each other from time to time. In this game you try to saddle opposing players with negative cards, and every little devil scores a penalty point. But take care: You will not escape the "diabolical" plans of your opponents either. Little Devils is a devilishly fun trick-taking game you keep on playing...

Little Devils is a fluent trick-taking game with simple rules:

Players don't need to follow trump or suit and can play higher or lower than previously played cards.
The second card played – and not the first – determines the goal for that round.
111173.name: Little Devils
boardgamepodcastepisode: OBG 92: Cult of the Old
The One About the Stronghold
The Party Gamecast Reviews Little Devils

111174.name: 2012: Godswake
111174.description:
...It is the year 2012, and the world is indeed coming to an end.
It’s been almost half a year now, and while many try to continue their normal way of living, others began to center their lives around these events, apostolating religious theories about the end of the world, or using the chaos to their own advantages. It is pretty obvious to everyone that there won’t be long before something big happens, although what that will be, or what the meaning of all this is, noone knows...

Godswake is an Adventure game for 2-4 players that plays in about one hour per player. The setting is the near future (or if you read this after 2012, an alternate Earth) when apparently the world is falling apart, but in a very unexpected, mythic, supernatural way. The characters – represented by the players – race against each other to get their hands on an allegedly extremely powerful relic amidst the chaos, with what they may not only be able stop the destruction, but also to assume a god-like power for themselves. However, it is a very hard task: the dangers lie not only in the natural catastrophes caused by the troubled matter of the Earth, but also in the insanity of people trying to deal with the coming of the apocalypse, in the rivalry of others who have the same goal in mind and in the appearance of supernatural events and creatures that have only lived in people’s imagination before. During their adventures the characters will probably travel around the world, visit exotic places, lead expeditions into relentless wildernesses in search for helpful minor Artifacts, face surprising Adventures and venture into disaster-ridden places all other people are running away from.

Card traits and game mechanics (such as Character Personalities that affect the outcome of adventures they have) all strive to keep the game as thematic as possible, while being simple and straight-forward at the same time. The game tries to keep a short playing time for an adventure game, while still being epic and memorable.

The game has been influenced by many sources ranging from Indiana Jones (regarding exploration in exotic places) and James Bond movies (high tech gear, daring action scenes), through the Supernatural tv-series (with the “ongoing apocalypse” setting), Hellblazer comics (giving it the darker tone, people with mystical powers, occult and magic), to the Stalker concept by the Strugatsky-brothers (regarding the whole weird zone called the Unknown, where the rumored relic lies). The mood of the game may feel like a mix of all of the above: quite dark and mature, but without resorting to graphic violence or vulgarity; a bit thought-provoking, but not taking itself too seriously.

The game uses lots of cards – around 350 in all – and many tokens as components, aside from a game board.

111175.name: Robinloft 2: Tahd's Legacy
111175.description:
from the back of the book

Welcome to an adventure of dark mystery and romance for the HackMaster system! Herein the PCs must sort dream from reality and face the daunting task of figuring out who the villain really is. Though this module is a sequel to the blockbuster "Robinloft" adventure, it can also be run independently from that work. Of course, those who played the first adventure will find a special surprise. Robinloft 2 is recommended for characters of 8-10th level.

111176.name: Nest
111176.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a standard RPGA Network tournament for a team of four to six 5th-level agents (though the serial’s challenges and XP rewards are tiered so that the serial can be played by up to six agents of levels 10, 15, or 20 as well).

Today…
After the agents track down a Faceless cell in China, the Agency learns of Walter Wainwright’s secret headquarters, a presumably abandoned company office in New York City and the penthouse above. The agents are given the green light to raid the complex and put an end to the villain’s plots once and for all. Unfortunately, their timetable is short, given that Wainwright seems ready to sell the Avis drug to the highest bidder, and that the sale is slated to happen inside or from his headquarters within the next 24 hours.

When the team enters the building, they find signs of recent combat and evidence that at least two rival forces are trying to kill each other on the premises. Further investigation on the ground floor reveals that the building is rigged with a variety of elaborate, high-tech death traps, and that another of Wainwright’s plans is already in motion. Worse, the building’s exterior windows and doors are apparently sealed shut and soundproofed — even direct gunfire can’t penetrate them. Radio and other signals can’t enter or escape. Screaming at windows has no effect, either, as they appear to be one-way mirrors — the agents can look out, but no one can see in. Wainwright wants what happens inside the building to stay in the building.

111178.name: Dangerous Dave
111178.description:
Dangerous Dave is a 1988 computer game by John Romero. It was developed for the Apple II and DOS as an example game to accompany his article about his GraBASIC, an Applesoft BASIC add-on, for the UpTime disk magazine. The object of the game was to collect gold cups to move on to the next level. Since the original 1988 publishing of Dangerous Dave on UpTime, there have been three sequels and three ports of the original to other platforms.

The idea of Dangerous Dave came to John Romero under the influence of Super Mario. There are definitely similarities that are easily noticeable, such as the secret levels, the level design, the monsters, and the jumping.

The mission is to guide Dave through ten levels, collecting trophies in the hideout of his enemy, Clyde.

Source: Wikipedia, "Dangerous Dave", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

111179.name: Digimon Racing
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Advance edition
111179.description:
Digimon Racing is a racing video game that utilizes characters and elements from the Digimon media franchise as well as those of traditional racing games. The game follows a group of Digimon competing in a racing tournament within the Digital World, home to all Digimon. The purpose of the grand prix is to determine who is the best racer; thus, they use specially designed karts that equate all contestants in terms of ability.

Digimon Racing's gameplay largely resembles that of traditional racing games. It focuses on competing against seven CPU-controlled characters in cup races consisting of three laps. The usage of items to attack opponents and improve one's own condition is an integral part of the gameplay, and adds an element of kart racing games. A new feature in the game is "kart hopping": using the karts to jump onto opponents, slowing them down. This adds an element of action gameplay. Digivolution, a recurring theme in Digimon, also plays a role in the game. Driving over energy hotspots scattered throughout the tracks increases an energy meter located at the bottom left of the game's HUD. As the meter increases, the player traverses the Digimon's evolutionary line, becoming more powerful and ultimately gaining the ability to use a special attack.

The game's fifteen tracks—four of which are available immediately—are based on conventional video game environments such as jungles, volcanoes, and cities. After completing a track for the first time, the player unlocks a time trial mode for this track, and a boss battle. The action-oriented boss battles involve defeating a generally static Digimon using items scattered throughout the areas, which are not designed as race tracks. The player can also compete in single races unrelated to the story in any unlocked tracks. The game uses the Game Boy Advance Wireless Adapter or Game Link Cable accessories for a multiplayer racing mode supporting up to four players.

Source: Wikipedia, "Digimon Racing", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

111180.name: Disney's Story Studio: Mulan
111180.description:
Box description:

Create, learn and play in a magical world! Recreate the legend of Mulan in this enchanting reading adventure, packed with games, activities, and more! Dress up Mulan and Mushu, create your own tales with the "Imperial Storymaker" and sing along with your favourite characters from the film.

Learning and fun all in one.

-Strengthen reading and storytelling skills.
-Build vocabulary with a fun dictionary and thesaurus.
-Improve problem-solving skills with games and puzzles.
-Inspire creativity with do-it-yourself activities.

111181.name: Presenting Elves
111181.description:
Family board game for Christmas, hunt for the presents in a winter village. Build the board to your own design including snow and cobble textures, 3D trees and 3D cottages.

Players are dealt toy cards and have to move clockwise or anti clockwise around the winter village board. If they land next to a cottage door square they can examine a present inside the cottage. The first player to find all their toys amongst the presents is the winner.

A simple, seasonal fun game for all the family.

111182.name: Vereimejate Kants: Kõige kõhedam lauamäng
111182.description:
Vereimejate Kants - Kõige kõhedam lauamäng (Bloodsuckers castle - the creepiest board game)

A population of humans are in danger. Behind the gray walls of the big castle, a clan of bloodsucking vampires have been living for centuries. The monsters and their evil master Thanateros have been terrorizing people for a long time and they have had enough of deaths and horror. Four bravest warriors will lead their soldiers to end vampires reign with superior "Speed", "Accuracy" and "Strength".
To get to the castle they first have to go through a dark forest where they have to fight with werewolves, zombies, forest vampires. In the castle real challenge awaits, there are vampires that have powers that no man can match. Unless the warriors find the amulets that make them worthy. By killing weaker enemies, player can collect amulets, what they need in order to enter the castle. 5 similar is required. Extra powers will be given to player when he collects the amulets.He can use second-level heroes, which are coming out from the "treasure" deck. As will be other cards that give bonuses or will ruin you.
Player are using dice to move and actioncards to fight the monsters.
Player can enter the castle when the amulets are collected. There player needs to fight even stronger vampires and after many fights, he needs to reach the master vampire Thanateros, which will be the final battle.
After victory, final move will be to roll the dice and see what happens to you in the future...

111183.description: One Captain's Log Supplemental card, given out as a promotional item at SPIEL'11.
111183.name: Star Trek: Expeditions – Tribbles! Promo

111184.name: Stock Collector
111184.description:
It is card game based on a stock markets behaviour, mostly on market direction. Direction of the market and the game depends on player decisions. Players are investors with stock portfolios and have a chance to by stocks or sell them. Their activity decides will it be a bull or a bear market.
Players have a chance to predict the market trend and act accordingly.
Who grows his portfolio most wins. It is fun, fast and easy game to learn.

111185.name: Der Eine Ring: Abenteuer am Rande der Wildnis
111185.description:
Publisher blurb (German):

Smaug ist besiegt, die Schlacht der Fünf Armeen wurde gewonnen und Bilbo, ist ins Auenland zurückgekehrt. Noch liegt der Ringkrieg einige Generationen in der Zukunft. In diesen vergleichsweise friedlichen Zeiten kommen die freien Völker der Wilderlande erstmals dazu, sich jenseits ihrer Grenzen umzusehen. Sie errichten Handelsrouten, erneuern Bünde zwischen ihren Kulturen und bringen einen gewissen Wohlstand in die Region zwischen dem nördlichen Düsterwald, dem Einsamen Berg und den östlichen Hängen des Nebelgebirges.

Aber noch immer drohen Gefahren, und an vielen Orten, von den Orkhöhlen der Gebirge bis zu den lichtlosen und unheilvollen Tiefen des Düsterwalds, liegt die Dunkelheit auf der Lauer, sammelt ihre Kräfte, schmiedet Pläne und dehnt unauffällig ihre Schatten aus...

Der Eine Ring: Abenteuer am Rande der Wildnis, das erste Buch des Systems spielt in der Umgebung des nördlichen Düsterwalds – spätere Veröffentlichungen werden dann einen größeren Teil von Mittelerde bespielbar machen. Auch die Handlung wird sich (allmählich) auf den Ringkriegs hin entwickeln.

Zum Bersten gefüllt mit unglaublichen Illustrationen der führenden Tolkien-Zeichner, unter anderem von John Howe, und angereichert mit sehr genauen Hintergrundinformationen, setzt das System von Der Eine Ring vor allem auf die Motive und Charaktere, die der Welt Mittelerde ihren einmaligen Platz in der Fantasy-Literatur eingebracht haben. Es hat noch nie ein Herr der Ringe-Rollenspiel gegeben, das sich so genau an der einzigartigen Sichtweise Tolkiens orientiert hat.

incl. 2 vollfarbige Posterkarten (ca. A2)


User Summary

The German translation by Uhrwerk Verlag was released in October 2011 as hardcover and as a limited-edition hardcover with a green leather-like cover and metal corner protection. 200 numbered copies of the latter were printed.

111186.name: Digitronic
111186.description:
Digitronic takes players to a virtual world. The characters are trapped in there and trying to find a way out. In order to get out they have to collect important data and eliminate all threats and enemies on their way and get to a portal to return to the real world.
The return to the real world is obtructed by two mighty viruses, Black OS-s, which has a Special code in them.
To return to reality player needs to find the same two Special codes and use them against the Black OS viruses.
In the digital world, player can also look for a Powercode, which is hastens players journey. Powercode also could have bit of the Special code.
During his fast ride through the virtual world, character encounters many different viruses which themselves are combination of codes.
To defeat the viruses, player has to attack with the same combination as does the virus.
PS. No dice involved.

111187.description: A single treasure card, given out as a promotional item at SPIEL'11 and to people who pre-ordered or Kickstarted Venture Forth.
111187.name: Venture Forth: Pandora's Jar Promo

111188.name: Euro Soldopoli
111188.description:
From the author Chiry2000:

A board game Monopoly like with new features and new mode to earn money. The players start working, buying needs and travelling around europe. Whenever a player want can start to manage shops, hotels and companies with workers that at the end of mounth require payments to maintain. The goal of the game is to get rich earning enough money to buy Car, plane, house, yacht and other luxury items, not before to satisfy basic needs that other players prevent to do increaising their cost. Win the player that has most values of luxury items when all of them are buyed. In this game is convenient spend many earned money cause there is the risk to buy useless things. The fan of this game is to encrease the prices to avoid that other players can terminate the match.


Dall'autore chiry2000:

Un gioco da tavolo stile monopoli con nuove funzioni e nuovi modi di guadagnare denaro. Completa la scheda personale per poter acquistare le monete da 1000euro. Lavora nelle 8 imprese del gioco o gestisci in esclusiva le stesse ditte che forniscono beni e servizi per completare le schede di tutti i giocatori. Attento alla casella di fine mese che potra' far fallire le tue imprese rendendole appetibili agli altri concorrenti che potranno rilevarle gia' a livello avanzato. Spendi piu' che puoi in modo da non essere costretti ad acquistare cose inutili e arricchire gli avversari. Vince il giocatore che avra' conquistato 5 gettoni da 1000euro o piu' degli altri.

111189.name: Dragon Ball Z: Supersonic Warriors
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Advance edition
111189.description:
User Summary

Based on the popular anime, Dragon Ball Z: Supersonic Warriors is a fighting game with a huge assortment of playable characters from the series. The game relies heavily on combos.

111190.name: Dragon Blade: Wrath Of Fire
111190.description:
Box description:

Fight fire with fire!

The power of the Dragons is in your hands. A young warrior must rise up against the demons who have ravaged his world. Find the pieces of the Dragon Blade and learn to unleash the unbelievable fury of a dragon.

-Harness all the powers of a Dragon!

-Unique two-handed combat.

-Epic boss battles!

-String together combos with a variety of Dragon powers!

111191.name: Dragon Tales: Dragon Adventures
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Advance edition
North American Game Boy Color edition
111191.description:
User Summary

Based off of the popular children's show. The game has three difficulty settings. The easiest setting allows younger players to freely explore the world without having to complete objectives. You can freely switch which dragon you control whenever you like. The goal of the game is to collect Dragon Berry cupcakes, gems, and muscial notes.

111192.description:
The Geisha is a promotional add-on role for Shitenno.

Set up : Place the Geisha Card on the Tohoku province.

Rule : When a player places a Kamon on the province where the Geisha is, he gets 2 additionnal points and the Geisha moves to the following province clockwise.
111192.name: Shitenno: Geisha Promo Card

111193.description:
Ora et Labora: Loamy Landscape is a single building card that was given out as a promotional item during Spiel 2011. The Lookout Games edition was English on one side and German on the other, with the card needing to be cut out by the user; other editions have only a single language.

Ora et Labora: Loamy Landscape, which is used only in the French variant, allows a user to switch the position of any two tokens on the rondel, then take either sheep, wheat or clay and move the appropriate token to zero on the rondel.
111193.name: Ora et Labora: Loamy Landscape

111194.name: Duke: The Apocalypse
111194.description:
User Summary

A shovelware collection of two expansion packs, Duke!ZoneII and Duke Xtreme. This is an unofficial, but authorized add-on for Duke Nukem 3D. Contains 550 levels, new monsters, and new weapons. You can also modify Duke's or most of the aliens' health.

111196.name: Nuke It 1000
111196.description:
User Summary

Contains 1000 additional levels for Duke Nukem 3D. 500 are single player only. The other 500 are multiplayer. Also includes codes, hints, and tutorials for creating your own levels.

111197.name: Duke Nukem: Total Meltdown
111197.description:
Box description:

Want to build a bad-ass alien? Create a world of complete chaos? Total Meltdown is all you need to take Duke Nukem 3D to the next level.

Go crazy with killer animation and sounds. Get medieval with the easy-to-use tools to customize and create your own nightmare levels. Go postal on any level at the speed of light with the browser. Total Meltdown is a munitions factory of action that you create. Plug it in, crank it up and hold on for the shock waves.

Features:

-Free Levels: Over 500 all new, ass-kickin' back breakin' levels devised by Duke's most devious and twisted fans.

-Level Customizer: Hundreds of new textures, animations and sounds are at your command. Build, edit, personalize, and go crazy with loads of added extras.

-New Characters: 35 new face-chomping characters add to the challenge of staying alive.

-Head-To-Head: Includes thrilling death-match levels for multi-player action - plus mega-tons of single player levels to play against the computer.

-Browser: Makes learning about levels, previewing maps and screen shots as easy as getting nailed by a bomb.

-Rated Levels: No more blind levels. Each has been carefully graded on difficulty, style and playability.

-Bonus Free Demos: Includes free, demos for 3-D Ultra Pinball - Trophy Bass - Shivers - RAMA - Phantasmagoria II: A Puzzle of Flesh - Print Artist 3.0.

111198.name: Duke Nukem: Critical Mass
111198.description:
Box description:

Duke Nukem is back and explodes onto the Nintendo DS for the first time!
With a loaded gun in one hand, a babe in the other and a one-liner for every situation, Duke is the ultimate action hero who's always ready to kick some alien butt!

111199.name: Circuito "Asfalto Violento"
111199.description:
Race Car
Circuito "Asfalto Violento" ("Violent Asphalt" Track)

It is entertainment for all ages, that only depends on the ability of each participant, without dice or roulette of any kind.

In this game, which is developing an exciting car race, you have similar situations to those of a true world championship.
Can compete from 3 to 6 participants.
Each participant chooses a team, that is 3 cars of the same color.
Each participant in turn moves the three cars 6, 5 and 4 steps. You can choose which auto advances 6, 5 and what that 4.
Additionally, if a car ends after another one, it can move 3 more steps (unless the track is blocked).
The first ten cars to complete the required number of turns obtained scores: 10 points for first, 9 for second and so on. The player who accumulates the highest score for his team es the winner.

111201.name: The Gods Hate Me
111201.description:
From the Publisher's Website:

This Cthulhu Invictus supplement offers seven adventures exploring the people and times of ancient Rome - mythic and Mythos-infected:


Enjoy a three-day holiday celebrated with gladiatorial games;
Explore an ancient cache of antiquities brought to Rome from ancient Egypt;
Build the demarcation wall ordered by Emperor Hadrian across the northern frontier of the Roman Empire;
Learn the cause of the rebellion of Spartacus;


These are but a sample from the winning entries for Chaosium's first Cthulhu Invictus adventure-writing contest.

111202.name: Writer's Block
111202.description:
Last Friday, at a local pub, you met up with some of your best mates. They’re like you: artist types, broke, kind of smelly. You tell them of your plan to write a hit sci-fi story and suddenly it catches fire! You rush home to your flat in an inspired haze and start writing that million-dollar story: The one about a bunch of Martians and a time machine. One week later, you return to the pub buzzing with excitement. Just as you are about to fill them in, Susie arrives boasting about her new tale, “Doomsday: The Martian Shrink Ray.” Moments later, Frank counters with a different story: “The Robot Toxin.” It would seem that your friends have all got the same idea. Happily, you laugh through the night comparing, modifying and sharing ideas. As Steve pours another round, a friendly wager arises: Who can write the best science fiction story in five weeks time? Looking down at your beer-stained draft, you toss twenty-dollars into the pot. This one’s in the bag, your pals don’t stand a chance. . .

This is a game of draft building. Each turn, players will add and subtract cards from a shared deck. Then, players will draft cards from this deck. After players have chosen a set of cards, they will take turns playing them. In a turn, players can choose to either discard cards (in order to save ink), or to spend ink to play cards (developing plot-lines). The plots players develop will then influence the next weeks workshop, as they help players to add and remove cards from the shared deck.

111204.name: The Venusian Kerfuffle
111204.description:
The Venusian Kerfuffle is a free Print and Play game of theme inspired by the MoV debacle. It is a simple dice bluffing game played over several rounds, as each player tries to lay claim to Venus. Or at least the licensing rights for it.

On each turn, both players roll their dice in secret, representing the strength of their legal claim. Players can bluff their way to victory, but must be careful. If too many rounds are tied or abandoned, the Lawyers will win instead! Nobody wants that.

The Venusian Kerfuffle requires four dice for each player, the one-page printout of the game, and three tokens.

111207.name: Horse Racing (1980)
111207.description:
From the Manual

OBJECT OF THE GAME is to "win" more than your opponents by being a successful handicapper as you place simulated wagers on these electronic horses during a 10-event "Day at the Races."

Up to 6 players each start with a $750 "stake." Races are run at distances from 3 furlongs to 10 furlongs, on different track conditions.

111208.name: Handicap Harness Racing
111208.description: A game that simulates harness racing and teaches the player to handicap, or predict real harness racing results. The game starts with Race #4. The previous Races (1,2,3) have already taken place and data from these races have been recorded on the Past Performance Chart. In actual harness racing there are various sources where you can gather the information that is needed to create a Past Performance Chart for actual horses & drivers. So based on the Past Performance chart you decided how much risk that you can take and place wagers on the race. The movement of the horses is based on the Past Performance chart data with probabilities of different outcomes based on a history of actual races. These probabilities are realized in the game thru movement cards and a spinner. The movement mechanism does not take into account all of the information that is recommended to be collected for making bets at the track. However, to take everything into account would make for an overly analytical game and would present the false concept that predicting races is just a matter of math. The game instructions explain all of the common terms and concepts that are considered important when deciding what bets to place. And it presents a logical method for recording important information needed to place bets. If you ignore the educational aspects of the game it is a fun game. The pawns movement mechanism is similar to the more well known Win Place & Show. In each round the rigs have a movement for the round and then two of the pawns receive bonus movement. The races in this game are much shorter than most other race games, about 4 rounds.

111209.name: Monster Tile Set
111209.description:
From the publisher's website

Our convenient Monster Tile set can be used in place of, or in conjunction with, miniatures for gaming. Each tile is conveniently numbered to make it easy for the GM to keep track of which creature has taken what damage. No more goblin hoards made of six-sided dice!

Monster Tiles are lightweight, store in very little space, durable, and quick to set up. When you're done, just scoop them into a box or bag and you're ready to go. Perfect for convention gaming!

This set contains:

12x Medium Tiles
6x Large
2x Huge
1x Gargantuan
1x Collosal Tile

Condition Tiles
3x flying
3x invisible
1x enlarged

111210.name: Wummy!
111210.description:
Wummy! is a word game that is family friendly as well as possibly educational. The ultimate goal of the game is to use all the letters (cards) in your hand to make words. Even short words count and you get extra points if you can link two short words into a larger one. For example, linking "PAN" and "CAKE" would get you "PANCAKE" for extra points.

Everything needed comes in the tin other than your own ability to create words.

The first to reach 30 points on their score card is the winner of this word game.

111211.name: Expanded Monster Tile Set
111211.description:
From the publisher's website

Due to the popularity of our Monster Tile Set, we have made an expansion! Players asked for more Huge and Medium creature tiles, and we listened.

Monster Tiles are lightweight, store in very little space, durable, and quick to set up. When you're done, just scoop them into a box or bag and you're ready to go. Perfect for convention gaming!

This expansion contains:
12x Medium Tiles (labeled 13-24)
6x Huge Tiles (labeled 3-6)

111212.name: Conditions Tile Set
111212.description:
From the publisher's website:

This set of tiles was designed to help the GM keep track of the different conditions of the characters and creatures in a scene. Like our other tile sets, the squares (with the exception of enlarged) are just under and inch on each side so they fit easily on 1" gridded maps. Use with our Monster Tile Set (make the %u201Cmonster tile set text a link to that page) or in conjunction with miniatures.

Conditional Tiles are lightweight, store in very little space, durable, and quick to set up. When you're done, just scoop them into a box or bag and you're ready to go. Perfect for convention gaming!

This set contains:
Ability damaged, Energy drained, Knocked down, Ability drained, Enlarged, Mirror Image, Blind, Entangled, Nauseated, Blink, Exhausted, Paralyzed, Blown away, Fascinated, Petrified, Checked, Fatigued, Pinned, Confused, Flat-Footed, Prone, Cowering (2), Flying (2), Shaken, Dazed, Frightened, Sickened, Dazzled, Grappling, Stable, Dead, Hasted, Staggered, Deaf, Helpless, Stunned, Dying, Invisible (2), Turned, Displaced, Incorporeal, Unconscious

111213.name: Crypt Tile set
111213.description:
From the publisher's website:

Newly redesigned! A great way to dress your dungeon without having to draw on your mat. The Crypt Tile Set is geared toward the creepier areas of a dungeon, where treasure or terror may lie in any corner!

Crypt Tiles are lightweight, store in very little space, durable, and quick to set up. When you're done, just scoop them into a box or bag and you're ready to go. Perfect for convention gaming!

This set contains:

Altar, 2x Pedestal, 6x Coffin, 4x Sarcophagus, 6x Column, Stairs Down, 6x Corpse, Stairs up, 4x Debris, Throne, Magic Circle, 3x Treasure

111214.name: Conveyance Tile set
111214.description:
From the publisher's website:

This set of tiles was designed to help the GM keep track of the different conditions of the characters and creatures in a scene. Like our other tile sets, the squares (with the exception of enlarged) are just under and inch on each side so they fit easily on 1" gridded maps. Use with our Monster Tile Set or in conjunction with miniatures.

Conditional Tiles are lightweight, store in very little space, durable, and quick to set up. When you're done, just scoop them into a box or bag and you're ready to go. Perfect for convention gaming!

This set contains:

2x Covered Carriage 10x15 (2"x3")
3x Cart 5x10 (1"x2")
4x Wagon 10x15 (2"x3")
5x Draft Horse 5x10 (1"x2")
5x Wagon Horse 5x10 (1"x2")

111215.name: Horse Tile set
111215.description:
From the publisher's website:

What would a traveling adventure be without the horses? The Horse Tile set makes it easy to keep track of player's horses, even if they become separated from the player. With mount size at 10x10 and the average PC only 5x5, it also helps to have a way to show the difference. This set of nicely drawn horses, allows for an entire party to have a choice in what they want to ride.

Horse Tiles are lightweight, store in very little space, durable, and quick to set up. When you're done, just scoop them into a box or bag and you're ready to go. Perfect for convention gaming!

This set contains:

Draft
Jousting
Chain Barding
2x Light
2x Heavy
Medium
Plate Barding
Plow
2x Wagon Team

111216.name: Encampment Tile set
111216.description:
From the publisher's website:

Most campaigns, at some point, require overland travel. Unless the road less-traveled by happens to have a lot of inns, this means setting up camp. Of course, the Encampment Tile Set also makes for an excellent way to set up a scene for sneaking into a camp.

Encampment Tiles are lightweight, store in very little space, durable, and quick to set up. When you're done, just scoop them into a box or bag and you're ready to go. Perfect for convention gaming!

This set contains:

Barrels (2)
Bedroll (6)
Fire (2)
Wood (2)
Equipment Pile 5x10 (2)
Large Tent 20x15
Medium Tent 10x15
Small Tent 5x10 (4)
Weapon Rack 5x10 (2)

111217.name: Spell Tents - Individual Buffs - Arcane
111217.description:
From the publisher's website:

These stand-up, miniature table tents help parties to keep track of the spells that are up, and what bonuses that they give to the players. This set contains many of the more useful individual arcane buffs, i.e. Fly, Mage Armor, Bull's Strength, and nine more of D&D 3.5's most useful group spells/abilities.

We designed this set after repeatedly having people miss attacks or saves because they forgot about bonuses that they had. It makes it alot easier to have a stand that shows that you can't grabble the PC because he has Freedom of Movement up.

111218.name: Spell Tents - Group Buffs
111218.description:
From the publisher's website:

These stand-up, miniature table tents help parties to keep track of the spells that are up, and what bonuses that they give to the players. This set contains many of the more useful group buffs, i.e. Hero's Feast, Prayer, Paladin's Aura of Courage, and nine more of D&D 3.5's most useful group spells/abilities.

We designed this set after repeatedly having people miss attacks or saves because they forgot about bonuses that they had. It makes it a lot easier to have a stand that shows that you are immune to poison because someone cast Hero's Feast at the beginning of the day.

111219.name: Cannon Tile Set
111219.description:
From the publisher's website:

Originally designed for use with the Dragonfire Armada. Set up your battlements and batten down the hatches with our Cannon Tile Set!

Cannon Tiles are lightweight, store in very little space, durable, and quick to set up. When you're done, just scoop them into a box or bag and you're ready to go. Perfect for convention gaming!

111220.name: Smithy Tile Set
111220.description:
From the publisher's website:

Newly redesigned! The Smithy (or Warehouse) Tile set came about with the revelation that many of us in our local group could not draw on a mat. The players were having a hard time telling what each item within the dungeon was. So we designed these to distinctly show off the different items within your average warehouse. After all many adventures lead the PCs to a warehouse, where they are inevitably ambushed. Using these tiles to layout the warehouse, can allow everyone to see what they can and cannot see.

Smithy Tiles are lightweight, store in very little space, durable, and quick to set up. When you're done, just scoop them into a box or bag and you're ready to go. Perfect for convention gaming!

This set contains:

2x Anvil
Fireplace
4x Barrel
4x Hay bale
4x Barrels
4x Junk Pile
4x Chest
4x Weapon rack
6x Crate
2x Workbench

111221.name: Tavern Tile Set
111221.description:
From the publisher's website:

Newly redesigned! A great way to set up a room without having to draw on your mat. The Tavern Tile Set is designed for setting up bar scenes, common rooms, and more. Now when things erupt into a mighty bar-room brawl, you'll know exactly where all the tables, chairs, and bars are.

Tavern Tiles are lightweight, store in very little space, durable, and quick to set up. When you're done, just scoop them into a box or bag and you're ready to go. Perfect for convention gaming!

This set contains:

2x Bar
Fireplace
4x Bench
6x Stool
6x Chair padded
Table round
6x Chair wooden
4x Table rectangle
2x Kegs

111222.name: Treasure Tile Set
111222.description:
From the publisher's website:

New! A great way to set up a room without having to draw on your mat. The Treasure Tile Set is designed for dressing up a room with those little details that just may be hiding something more... or not.

Treasure Tiles are lightweight, store in very little space, durable, and quick to set up. When you're done, just scoop them into a box or bag and you're ready to go. Perfect for convention gaming!

This set includes:

3x Artifact
2xDesk
Armoire
Dresser
2x Bed
2xPedestal

2xPedestal book

111223.name: Terrain Tile Set
111223.description:
From their Web Stie

In our gaming experience, drawing outside locations, especially wooded areas, seems to drive GMs to fits. The terrain tile set was created based on feedback from players who liked our crypt, tavern, and smithy sets. We put together a set that will allow the DM to put out the most common objects a party will run into in the woods. The idea is to provide the obstacles that the PCs will have to get around for any combat that they get into. Or just to make them worry that they will be getting into combat...

Terrain Tiles are lightweight, store in very little space, durable, and quick to set up. When you're done, just scoop them into a box or bag and you'reready to go. Perfect for convention gaming!

This set includes:

2x Boulder 10x10 (2"x2")
3x Tree 10x10 (2"x2")
2x Log 2.5x5 (0.5"x1")
Tree 20x20 (4"x4")
2x Log 5x10 (1"x2")
6x Tree 5x5
2x River 10x15 (2"x3")
3x Trees 10x10 (2"x2")
3x Swampy 5x5
Trees 15x15� (3"x3")
2x Stream 5x10 (1"x2")
3x Weedy 5x5

111224.name: Spell Tents - Individual Buffs - Divine
111224.description:
From their Web Stie

These stand-up, miniature table tents help parties to keep track of the spells that are up, and what bonuses that they give to the players. This set contains many of the more useful individual arcane buffs, i.e. Shield of Faith, Death Ward, Bull's Strength, and nine more of D&D 3.5's most useful group spells/abilities.

We designed this set after repeatedly having people miss attacks or saves because they forgot about bonuses that they had. It makes it a lot easier to have a stand that shows that you can't grabble the PC because he has Freedom of Movement up.

111225.name: Eternal Shadows
111225.description:
From the back cover:

When things go bump in the night, victims need to become survivors. Eternal Shadows is a genre-specific rules variant for the Adventure Game Engine published by Green Ronin Publishing.

This core book contains classes suited for play in a modern world. It contains modern gear, including firearms, and vehicles, and a magic system more suited to the uncertainty and tone of the Horror gaming genre.

Also included are numerous resources for the Game Master to evoke feelings of helplessness, mortality, and horror at the game table. This includes fear and instability, monstrous opponents, and changes to the combat system for both PCs and their foes.

The shadows lengthen as heroes muster up the courage to fight. Do you dare join their number?

A copy of the Dragon Age Box Set is required to play

111226.name: Omnicron
111226.description:
Test your might against the perilous onslaught of mechanized military weaponry, embryonic aliens, and demonic monsters! Click on blue things to absorb their energy and increase your killing power! Feed your need for fast paced, bullet dodging arcade action with Omnicron!

Source: The Developer Website.

111227.name: Goal! Game expansion pack: French Team
111227.description: This expansion is packaged like a CCG booster. It contains 14 player cards of the French football team and one new special tactics card.

111228.name: Würfelkrieger
111228.description:
In this small-scale miniatures game, 2 players control one hero and a number of henchmen who try to gain the most points by destroying enemy figures and collecting objectives on the "board".

All miniatures and dice are magnetic, and the playing field is built from flexible cloth "boards" with a wire mesh layer in the center.

111229.name: King-Pin Bowling Alley
111229.description: A game similar to a target game but here it is shooting a ball from one end of the base to the skittles at the other end. As in a target game, the player who scores the most points in a pre-set time limit, wins.

111230.name: Stock Car Race Game
111230.description: A basic roll and move game but with extra rules to allow for collisions (It is a Stock Car Race after all).

111231.description:
This game is for very young children to develop powers of observation and colour recognition.

Three dice are used to play this game. One of the three colours that come up on the dice will bring the player’s mouse figure furthest ahead on the board. That’s where (s)he should put the mouse. The winner is the first mouse to reach the large larder.
You need to pay close attention and know the colours to be the first to get your mouse into the larder.
111231.name: Pips & Betsy

111232.name: Richelieu's Guide to Serious Situations
111232.description:
